reviews.review_title: It deserves all the Oscar recognition
reviews.content: But would it make it?That's another story to witness but for now the movie has delivered flawlessly in every aspect.An industry that is known for action packed movies making it a courtroom drama of this level without a single action sequences is a major success.It also proves that South Movies are much more than action and emotional pack.The courtroom battle though one sided but being a true story that can be sideline as the movie's focus is not witty courtroom arguments but the injustice suffered by tribal community from Govt and Police. And it wonderfully addressed this.I didn't know that it based on true story and characters. So, the Oscar worth moments came as the movies ends and introduce real life Justice Chandru.Hats off to Suriya!

reviews.review_title: A Movie that strongly talks about discrimination but Ironically discriminates a set of people!
reviews.content: Jai Bhim is one of the Intense thrillers with a strong message and never ending controversies in recent times!Movie opens up with hint of Caste based oppression, poverty and courtroom drama.It keeps ticking on all the above mentioned three elements throughout the movie.The characterisation of the roles in the movie is perfect and it makes the viewers feel the emotions of characters.Its so gripping and kindles anger against oppression in multiple scenes and even through the movie.Especially the scenes of torture in police station, kidnapping of the female child and ill treatment to women of the tribal communities are so powerful and gripping.A perfect movie which talks about discrimination but still discriminates a particular set of people by linking the antagonist to the symbols or identities of a particular group which could have been avoided.If it was done for the case of reality or since it was based on the true life incidents, it provokes a strong question in the minds of viewers, why the names of antagonist alone is changed in comparison to the real life incidents.It makes viewers think what is the motive of the director, whether its to talk against discrimination or to say Eye for An Eye!Ironically the movie itself discriminates against a particular group of people , through Identity politics and name changes !Discrimination is not acceptable even if jai BHIM does it!

A great attempt by the director and the production house ( 2D Entertainment ).I can feel the pain they felt.I'm really sad for the people. We all should stand against the untouchability and the casteism.

The movie, though slow in its first half, does a great job at bringing out the misuse of power by the Indian police force and the unjust treatment meted out to the tribal and lower caste communities of India. Still treated as untouchables, Dalits face great oppression every day across India and with the scenes in the police room or the general harassment faced by the characters, the movie does a fairly good job at bringing out the daily agonies of these oppressed citizen. The script is what makes the movie class apart, with fairly decent acting. The editing and shot selection could do with more finesse but the ending is just worth every wait and will surely make you tear up.

The movie is excellent & appreciate the effort, however it's high time Indian movies stop encouraging the tell-tales of the past suffering. It sets a bad precedence on the international stage.The bad behavior of police was inherited from the British and it continues to exist, yet there are some good policemen who continue to uphold Justice. I would say Prakash-Raj was the hero of the movie and yet all attention was on Surya. There are some really unbearable scenes in the movie that could have been replaced with suggestions on how system could have handled it better. This was success only because it was on streaming, if it was released in theaters it would have had another story to tell.

reviews.review_title: Jai Bhim definitely sowed seeds of equality again
reviews.content: There was a famous dialogue in the Hollywood movie, Lincoln. "Congress must never declare equal those who God created unequal." But still after so much debate Lincoln's power brought the under privileged rights on par with other humans on that time. This movie is one such historic movie, where an angry young south Indian lawer stood by TRUTH and against the mighty Government power and Caste power to win the case for an innocent tribal women whose husband was killed by police brutality.
No one could have played justice Chandru better than Thiru Suriya prakash sir is always in the role he plays they acted as if they are the actual characters.Best movie I've seen this year.

One of the exceptional, outstanding movies of Hot Chocolate, Hot Shot, Actor Suriya (Younger Killer Looks). Court drama that is so thoroughly astonishing & engaging right from the start of the movie. Distinctively unique, even from the very first 5-10 minutes. Definitely from the lines of "Visaranai", I am getting used to the recent cinematic legal works such as Nerkonda Paarvai, Ponmagal Vandhal etc, these kind of thought-provoking scripts is fast catching up as a trending inspiration for all film makers.In his Brave & Bold attempt, Director TJ Gnanavel 's Jai Bhim (2 hours, 45 minutes long) flawlessly speaks about custodial violence, police cover-up, systemic corruption at a huge level, that is so hard to logically digest or reason out the whole truth and finally there would be no end to the entire picture. The blame game is never ending.I can add to this saying that Jai Bhim is actually truly-brutally honest, clear-cut reality filled with heart-wrenching scenes, that is sure to leave you feeling that there is more bad in this world than good.One can praise Actor Suriya for his super star performance that is so shockingly awesome, only to discover embarrassing sheets of lies, caste hatred and cruelty. Actor suriya has done a wonderful job of acting so well & so concealed, that I just forgot him in the process, being so much involved in the amazing narration of this deeply appealing, story-telling method that the writer TJ Gnanavel has crafted & adopted.Huge round of applause for the extreme level beautiful Cinematography of S. R. Kathir, which gave this movie it s core life & the element of suspense. Music by Sean Roldan is noteworthy in it s own way, made me feel pain and all kinds of emotions throughout the film. Other actors namely Prakash Raj who shines seperately as usual due to his sensible acting portions for a supporting role, while Rajisha Vijayan, Lijomol Jose, Rao Ramesh deserve a standing ovation and especially K. Manikandan who earned the merit of a special mention. One wonders how he actually did all those gruesome scenes.The director unquestionably has to be awarded for the stupendous success of this movie which solely entertains family audiences without depending upon masala factor or "mass"components.I would definitely watch it again as it was based on detailed portrayal of true events & people!Hats off to the entire Cast & Crew, Team of Jai Bhim! Cheers!

reviews.review_title: An artsy approach would have been more preferable
reviews.content: A politically charged social commentary that not only dare to unmask custodial malpractices and violations committed by police personnel but also exposes the darker alleys of casteism and intolerance that is still pretty persistent in our country. An issue that I believe, should be construed as a topic of discussion more often!That being said, I'm still not fully convinced. Make no mistake, I wholeheartedly admire the cause as well as the initiative taken by the whole team but my biggest gripe is about its core treatment, which for better or worse has mostly been mass-centric. Probably due to the inclusion of superstar 'Suriya' in this narrative.Now, I do understand, why the creators might have taken such a lenient route! Their primary incentive was to reach a much broader base of the audience rather than limiting themselves to a niche category and in that regard, they went for the most reasonable choice vacant. But then again, a delicate subject like this, in my humble opinion, rather asks for an artsy & articulative way of storytelling.I'm in no way implying this was a bad attempt, not at all. On the contrary, I do appreciate the honesty and the audacity of the makers for even thinking about making such a movie that would dauntlessly question the injustices and would put a mirror on our administration and the jurisdiction for self-reflect. It's just that I beg to differ in the journeys taken not the destination it aspired to go to.

In simplest terms, Jai Bhim can be likened to 'To Kill A Mockingbird'.It is a shocking, moving, heart rending and poetic tale, told with patience and courage. The execution of the tale is epic in proportion, and the ground which must be covered to achieve this is carefully, successfully plotted for us, the viewer. That it is based on the determined work of a living person, who strove to have justice reach the poorest of the poor in India, makes this achievement in cinema and storytelling, hugely satisfying. It's a damn good story and piece of film making from a movie industry which is showing itself equal to any in the world.

What's more fascinating is , this story is based on a real life person, Justice K. Chandru, A profound soul, utmost respect for him!!, very few can have the courage to be like him. Its a pitty we don't get to know about such people.Kudos to the director, TJ Gnanavel for taking up this subject, handling it with utmost sincerity, honesty and sensitivity . All technicians involved in this movie deserve equal praise as no aspect of the movie lets it down.LSarvanan shivakumar aka suriya -hatsoff!!Suriya - what a performer, an actor par excellence, he deserves a lot of credit to take up this subject and perform it with utmost care and sincerity .Lijomol jose- the actress who played the role of sengeni was outstanding. This role will stay with me for a long time.Manikandan who played rajakannu also gives a splendid performance, heartbreaking performance.The other actors from prakash raj to rao ramesh to other actors who played parts of tribal people all deserve great appaluse.THIS IS A MOVIE WHICH SHOULD BE WATCHED BY EVERYONE. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS ONE.

My 2, sorry 10 cents -
1. 3 men are caught by police for a crime they did not commit. Yes - the director believed Indian audience has never see this before
2. They r tortured to confess the crime and during 3rd degree one dies. Trust me - it's not from crime patrol or savdhan india . It's from the highest rated movie on IMDB.3. The police is torturing them coz they are in poverty and living a life too low to protest. But this fact does not suite agenda so let's introduce caste.4. Here comes a cool-dude-version of Ambedkar who believes Ambedkar must be kept at par with Gandhi and Nehru. Not sure how many nanoseconds Mr Ambedkar passed in jail. With all due respect he has a reserved place for him in history. What does this question mean in movie is beyond human know abilities.5. Judges are shown in such a poor light that almost all witnesses from defence lie million times but they just excuse them with a funny face. Reality is that lying in court is contempt of court + damaging the credibility of entire case from the perspective of the accused7. Courtroom drama is presented in a very non-dramatic environment. Director fails miserably to make it look real. Who on the earth will believe the logic presented in the court?8. The entire story gets a positive end because of few key people - the doctor, the booth guy and the officer(Prakash raj). They all have been shown to belong to community of the accused. Still the hatred narrative is set against the community of accused.9. Lastly, the title - Jai Bhim ? Seriously ? It's a political slogan of a political party. You guys seriously wanted us to believe that the movie wanted to be justifiable and appreciable despite being politically motivated so much so that it's titled on a political slogan. Are we really jokers?10. Scan your own friend list and see how many people from these categories are there . Ask yourself - did you personally misbehaved with them for their cast?? No! Then who r these people wanting to make you believe that you have been brutal towards certain cast and communities .

reviews.review_title: Jai Bhim. The voice of the voiceless and their faith in the justice system.
reviews.content: Jai Bhim. The voice of the voiceless and their faith in the justice system.Police terror and caste discrimination are not new in Tamil cinema, why Jai Bhim is set apart from others is because of the intensity in the presentation.Judgments are made in each court but to what extent can people gain faith in the court and the judiciary through those orders? Director TJ Gnanavel who wrote the screenplay and directed, reveals that belief moreover argues that not only those in power, but the oppressed also should have right to have a piece of land and justice for them on this earth.Jai Bhim's screenplay is based on a real-life incident that took place in Tamil Nadu in 1993, a legal battle fought by Sengani; the wife of a young man named Rajakannu with the support of Advocate Chandru played by Surya. In the real life when Chandru was a judge, he would ask lawyers in court not to call him 'My Lord' since he was neither at all interested in such expressions of power nor did he have a personal security, moreover he did not hesitate to declare his private property publicly. From the day he became a judge until the day he retired, he left his official vehicle and drove home on a local train. Justice Chandru has settled 96,000 cases in his notable judicial career, that too during his six and a half years as a judge.'Jai Bhim' directed by TJ Gnanavel, a biopic of Chandru (later Justice Chandru retired from the Madras High Court) is being discussed everywhere. The film is about the legal battle and victory of Rajakannu's widow Sengani against the police during 1996-97 with the help of Advocate Chandru. The Rajan case in Kerala is widely cited in the Habeas corpus case filed by Sengani to find Rajakannu.The film begins with those who are released from jail being segregated by caste, showing how much caste is deeply rooted awkwardly in our society even after so many years of Independence. Throughout the film we see the life of Irular (dark class) caste who are seen and ignored by society as slaves, the screenplay accurately canvassed their work, culture, food, and customs very precisely, the director never failed in detailing it throughout the film. The film says that the voice of the voiceless should be the judiciary system. There are many lessons to be learned from the Raja Kannu for the crime he did not commit and the tears of Pregnant Sengani who waited in hope for his release but in vain at the last. In spite of many years passed after independence, the Irular tribe does not own land or voter ID and ration cards, their social status is conducive to being prosecuted in unproven cases.When it comes to actors, the first thing to mark is Actress Lijo Mol who came as dark skinned Sengani, has succeeded in conveying all her agony to the audience with minute actions precisely, a national award will be on the way to her.Actor Manikandan who essayed the crucial and pivotal role Rajakannu has been basking in the glory of the incredible success who had the strenuous job of interpreting the character that has various stratums of complex emotional phases. He did a fabulous job and the whole story revolves around his innocence and the torture he had undergone by the corrupted power. He tailored his character so astonishingly, the audience felt they are getting the Police brutality and pain.Surya reaching as Chandru is extra ordinary in his performance keeping aside his usual introduction BGM, Slow motion, dances and acrobatic stunts and has to be appreciated first, for making such a film to bring out the life of the suppressed to public and secondly for playing such a convincing role 100 percent loyal to real Lawyer Chandru and giving more screen space for the character Rajakannu. When Sengani describes her plight, the slightest movement in the muscles of Chandru's face is enough to understand how much Surya, the actor, is drawn into the role.The director made a detailed study to communicate his feelings through the screenplay to the audience and in one scene, we can see the reference related to the Rajan murder case during the state of emergency in Kerala, Chandru argued in the Madras High Court at that time that this case (Rajakannu) should be seen in the same way as the Rajan case and filed a habeas corpus. Jai Bhim travels with Sengani, Rajakannu follwed by Chandru, their tears are burning in the audience's chest.Prakash Raj as IG Perumal Swamy, who slaps a Hindi-speaking witness in the face with a dialogue 'Tamil Pesuda', (Speak in Tamil) evokes the anti-Hindi Dravidian spirit inherent in Tamils. All the supporting actors are real people from Irular Caste, never familiar with any modern visual medias, hats off to director bringing them in the frame as it is.After watching Jai Bhim the movie goer definitely will be in a state of trauma as Rajakannu's and Sengani's quandary sink deep down in their heart, and at the outset that's the success of the film.

reviews.review_title: An outright anti-Hindu propaganda movie that distorts history.
reviews.content: The makers of this outright anti-Hindu propaganda movie have already apologised to Hindus for faking history and showing the anti-dalit Christian cop as a Hindu Vanniyar.In the real incident, the name of the Police Sub-inspector who was involved in the custodial death of the tribal prisoner was "Anthony Samy"(a Christian), whereas filmmakers Suriya and Ghanavel deliberately showed the guilty Christian cop as a Hindu named Gurumurthy with a Hindu calendar and a fire pot that belongs to Hindu Vaniyar Sangam.There are deliberate instances where the Vanniyar community symbols are showcased in the film, in relation to the villain. The community's image was deliberately being tarnished, given how the film's villain is guilty of committing brutal custodial torture and murder of a member of a downtrodden community of tribals, who is wrongly accused and framed by a Christian cop Anthony.How can this propaganda be a movie.

Suriya is terrific as an advocate. He stuns all with his body language, mannerisms, and dialogues. He came with subtle and powerful expressions and his new look attracts all. The actor should be appreciated for picking up such scripts.Lijomal Jose who plays the tribal lady is astonishing in her role. The way she portrays a helpless pregnant lady fighting for her husband is terrific. In the same way, Manikandan, who plays Rajanna is also intense. Be it his look or the way he showcases the pain in all the investigation scenes looks realistic.Rajisha Vijayan also came with a good performance.Rao Ramesh as an advocate showed different mannerisms and body language compared to his earlier films.Prakash Raj performed well as a police officer.Rest of the all other actors are justifying their roles.

reviews.review_title: TO, who gave 1 star and hate this movie
reviews.content: TO, who gave 1 star and hate this movie there is a dialoge in the move.soorarai pottru Neenga(you pepole are) socialite nanga (we are ) socilist. Neenga vara nanga vara. And i saw few comments saying that this movie has violence and communist ideologies. I think those didn't aware this movie inspired by the true incident that happened way back in 1993. A man named Rajakannu from the Irular tribe was falsely framed in a theft case. The horrific death of Rajakannu due to the custodial torture was a challenging and landmark legal battle for Justice K. Chandru is a former Madras High Court Judge appointed by President Dr. A. P. J. Abdul Kalam to the Madras High Court. When the victim's wife Sengani (real name Parvathi) came to the lawyer for help and the case trail was happened 15 years and he is not charging a single rupee for this case.And some people say that this movie portrait hight violence, in the recent interview by Chandru told that the violence portrait in the movie is not even a 50% shown in the movie and he told that police removed dress oof rajakannu and his mother and beaten them to have intercourse in front of them. The people who watched this move in the 52 inch LED with high end sound system will not understand the pain of the oppressed people. The worst part is still this kind of incident is still happening around us. As said by the nation award winner director Vetrimaran this year, people who don't link the social justice will not support this kind of movies and this is not wondering any more.Jai Bhim is the power full word to protect oppressed people, this move dose that very well and this kind of move is very important to the society. We have to encourage this movie. I my point of view 10* is very very less for this movie infact this movie is apart from rating.Please do watch and support for this movie.

reviews.review_title: For the people, of the people, by the elite
reviews.content: Where I lived in Patna, a community called Mushahar lived around us. Shriek cries of pigs being hunted and skinned, their catch of field rats and squirrels that they displayed, their habitat and drunken squabbles bothered our middle-class sensibilities a lot. Even in those urban surroundings, we were all told to take care of our belongings from these nomadic urchins. 'Jai Bhim' took me back to those personal memories and showed me a mirror of ignorance and insensitivity towards these marginal communities.The film's pitch is set to the populist tunes and though there is no fight sequence with the hero, the background music, gestures of the 'star', the camera angles - they all build up the hero worship Tamilnadu is so much known for. Personally, I feel an actor like Vijay Sethupati would have brought more layers to the protagonist's character. Suriya, even in this author backed role, seemed much of a star and less of a seasoned lawyer. Prakash Raj too was routine.The real 'hero' of the film is Lijomol Jose's Sengeni. Her physical acting and lack of expressions while helpless will haunt a sensitive viewer for long. Just that they had to blacken an otherwise fair actress for a role hurts me a bit. Same as Suriya, I think a naturally deglamorized actress would have been fitter for the film.Manikandan's Rajakannu, Rajendran's Mosakutty, Tamizh as SI Gurumurthy - and the rest of the cast bring to life the daily day toils, joys and sorrows of the incidents and characters.It is a difficult film to watch. The torture scenes should have come with a warning for the mentally not so strong people. If it gets so disturbing at times to watch, I can't begin to imagine how difficult the lives of such marginal communities actually are.The movie could have done with some editing. Even without the melodrama creating background music, the film would have remained as effective. I think the film could have opened with Sengeni waiting to meet Advocate Chandru and the rest could have unfolded gradually. Narration through flashback, as a trope, has not been well exploited in this film.This is a necessary film. The sage Ramakrishna Paramhansa had said, "Theatre educates the masses", and the same can be said about this film.Just to document the plight of the marginal tribes who struggle every day to prove their existence despite their skills and demanding work could have given the film much credence. That the director has attempted to do so within the parameters of popular cinema makes it even more creditable. Gnanavel seems deft in handling the scenes depicting the masses. Where he had to blend the same with the matinee icon's charisma, there are a few hiccups.I have given an extra star in the review just due to the boldness of the makes and Prime Videos to let this film happen. Though set at a pitch a tad higher than necessary, the film delivers the message home.To conclude, the medium of cinema, an OTT channel and a viewer like me who is privileged to use internet and a holiday to watch make me write the caption of this review. This cinema remains as a peep into the masses through an elitist binocular.
Powerful movie, definitely needs to be watched. Superb casting, great performances all around, great dialogues.The only thing I would have appreciated would have been some more legal drama.
Just an amazing movie.There are very rare movies like this to watch nowadays, every Indian should watch this movie.The cast is outstanding, every actor has done there job very good.I am speechless.

reviews.review_title: A near-great commercial film about social injustice.
reviews.content: The moment I finished watching Jai Bhim I was left wondering whether Surya playing the lead is a boon or a bane. On one hand the presence of a big star like Surya would inevitably lead to certain "mass" scenes which might bother the emotional flow and on the other hand his presence would also bring in tons of audience to this film that is addressing an important issue. Jai Bhim is about a horrific real incident that happened in the 90's but the problem it's addressing is as relevant today as it was back then. The initial portions of the film where we see the life of Irulars are amazing. We get to know them, their lifestyle and, most importantly, how they're treated. Then the film segues into the real issue. I wish the film had been treated like Visaranai. This movie is just a bit too commercial for such a sensitive topic but i get it, a film like Visaranai would never reach as many people as this has. Anyways this is a very important film about casteism, social injustice and police brutality.
Super Movie. Must Watch For All People. So Pls Don't Miss It. All Cast And Crew Acting Fantastic Job. Music Are Very Good. Especially Thala Kothum Song Superb.

amazingly awesome.Suriya sir yet another masterpiece after soorati potrru. He grabed the show and also being such a huge star he let others to play their respective roles as more than him.At last it's a must watch movie if u love true art and content because it shows reality , I mean harsh reality so, it may be hated by some .But people can feel the pain of the story.
I noticed how this film has a 9.6/10! The highest rated film except for Blue She'll Incident. And I don't get it.Yeah there's some good aspects but why is this so highly rated?

One of the exceptional, outstanding movies of Hot Chocolate, Hot Shot, Actor Suriya (Younger Killer Looks). Court drama that is so thoroughly astonishing & engaging right from the start of the movie. Distinctively unique, even from the very first 5-10 minutes. Definitely from the lines of "Visaranai", I am getting used to the recent cinematic legal works such as Nerkonda Paarvai, Ponmagal Vandhal etc, these kind of thought-provoking scripts is fast catching up as a trending inspiration for all film makers.In his Brave & Bold attempt, Director TJ Gnanavel 's Jai Bhim (2 hours, 45 minutes long) flawlessly speaks about custodial violence, police cover-up, systemic corruption at a huge level, that is so hard to logically digest or reason out the whole truth and finally there would be no end to the entire picture. The blame game is never ending.I can add to this saying that Jai Bhim is actually truly-brutally honest, clear-cut reality filled with heart-wrenching scenes, that is sure to leave you feeling that there is more bad in this world than good.One can praise Actor Suriya for his super star performance that is so shockingly awesome, only to discover embarrassing sheets of lies, caste hatred and cruelty. Actor suriya has done a wonderful job of acting so well & so concealed, that I just forgot him in the process, being so much involved in the amazing narration of this deeply appealing, story-telling method that the writer TJ Gnanavel has crafted & adopted.Huge round of applause for the extreme level beautiful Cinematography of S. R. Kathir, which gave this movie it s core life & the element of suspense. Music by Sean Roldan is noteworthy in it s own way, made me feel pain and all kinds of emotions throughout the film. Other actors namely Prakash Raj who shines seperately as usual due to his sensible acting portions for a supporting role, while Rajisha Vijayan, Lijomol Jose, Rao Ramesh deserve a standing ovation and especially K. Manikandan who earned the merit of a special mention. One wonders how he actually did all those gruesome scenes.The director unquestionably has to be awarded for the stupendous success of this movie which solely entertains family audiences without depending upon masala factor or "mass"components.I would definitely watch it again as it was based on detailed portrayal of true events & people!Hats off to the entire Cast & Crew, Team of Jai Bhim! reviews.review_title: Most powerful medium, explored to its fullest! Well, it made me sign-up on imdb!!!
reviews.content: Film is probably the most powerful medium to date, to get someone you have never seen or known to see what you see as you see it. To realise the full potential of its power, you need a message that is strong and abiding, you need a life experience exploring the full breath of the message, you need impeccable technical proficiency that is unobtrusive, you need uncompromising artistic integrity that understands every silver pixel in every frame is as important as every other- that they paint the one picture over the whole span of the film, you need adherence to truth as expressed through the life of the characters, you need minimal script to render the communication language independent, you need understated music scores enabling you to pack time, you need background music to to string your scenes seamlessly, you need artistes who shine by their effortless restrain, enabling every other artiste bring-out their best, and you need a story that every one of your audience can resonate with either through their own direct experience or through indirect experience from others they know or headline news or history.Jai Bhim ticks every box. The last movie that ticked every box for me was Blood Diamond. The oscars missed the chance to see what was shown in 2006- here's an opportunity to correct.

The movie is not cheesy or fast like other Tamil movies. It gradually builds up a rational story. The only thing I felt bad after watching the movie is that the real woman (sengini) did not get the compensation which the movie depicts. Other than that, its a top notch movie.

It is both scenic and sinister at the same time. If you are a cheap wiper and light hearted person avoid watching this in front of others. This movie is something which is more realistic than a documentary. Nothing epic yet the most epic journey. Nothing dramatic yet drama at its best. No bold action move or super heroism yet portrays the heroic battle like a medieval knight's heroic tale. Do yourself a favor, have a watch. You will be mesmerized. True story or not this is as much true as it can get.

J. Gnanavel. The script of the movie is outstanding and Suriya and Lijomol Jose did a stupendous job in this movie.

reviews.review_title: Great film but far from prefect

Director manages to transform a documentary to a commercial movie. I also felt in some moments that it was trying to gloryfy commuinsm but still it can be pardoned. Although being nearly three hour long and a tad bit preditible this film still held my attention,it manages to show pain and agony of what these tribal went through quite painstakingly.
Being super star I can't believe that Surya produced and acted in this movie. I hope other heroes will start acting in this movies. Great job by all the actors.

A pregnant woman from a primitive tribal community, searches desperately for her husband, who is missing from police custody. A High Court advocate rises in support to find her husband and seek justice for them.The slogan) is a 2021 Indian Tamil-language legal drama film directed by T. J. Gnanavel and produced by Jyothika and Suriya under 2D Entertainment.They chose the title Jai Bhim, which translates to "victory to Bhim", a popular slogan used by followers of BR Ambedkar, the Indian social reformer who's revered as the father of the InMhow cantonment, where his father served in the Army. Dr B R Ambedkar was born in a caste which was considered as the lowest of the low.

reviews.review_title: A good movie with plenty of noise pollution .
reviews.content: As with most good South movie , it is spoiled by too many unwanted noises created by the casts . I found it unbearably irritating the way the women in the movie , especially the wife of the victim cries in every scene unnecessarily. Tears are effective on screen when they are shown only when necessary , making it occur every second scene , combined with lots of wailing and bawling , just diminishes its effectiveness in garnering sympathy . If fact every time she started wailing I hoped the cop would shut her up . Maybe, it's only in the Hindi dubbed version that all these unnecessary loud noises are shown and not in its original format. But all the same a good movie was ruined by some very unwanted overacting by its female casts and a few male cast as well , like the short guy in the lock up as well as in the end at the court .what any guy in court would have given his statement in a normal and controlled manner , this fellow was overflowing with mile long tears and wailing with more unwanted noises .When he was doing his teary acts , I so wanted the cop or anyone in the movie to just kill him too , just to shut his bawling .It was that unbearable. Why couldn't the director make it more realistic and less melodramatic like rest of the movie ? Would have been well deserving the fantastic IMBD ratings had it not been for these stupid melodramas and sound pollutions . Having said that , the movie was an out an out entertaining movie and thoroughly captivating .

reviews.review_title: Packs a punch with a social message
reviews.content: Movie Review / Jai Bhim / Tamil / Prime Video / 4.5/5 / No spoilersJai Bhim is a cinematic marvel based on the real life inspiring story of Justice K Chandru. An Iyer Brahmin lawyer, who stood up for the human rights of marginalised tribal community against the corruption and atrocities of police.Right from the first scene, this film grips you and shows you lifestyle of a community you can never imagine. In fiction, you have the liberty to cook up any story but this is a fact which happened not too far in history but in 1996. I am glad writer and director Gnanavel brought out this story to the audience. There are some of these scenes, which just stayed with me... tribals hunting for their food, owl looks at them like a CCTV camera, chemistry between Rajakannu and Sengenni. Gnanavel hasn't delivered anything great before but he would be in a different league after this film. First half of the film moves smoothly with well established characters and tension between the oppressed and the oppressor. 2nd half becomes less magical as courtroom drama doesn't offer us anything new in terms of cinematic marvel.Casting of the film is superb too. On one side there are well known actors like Suriya, Prakash Raj, Guru Somsundaram, there are unknown faces who gel well with the characters they are playing. My favourite being Manikandan playing Rajakannu and Lijo Jose playing Sengenni. Acting is top notch of all the actors. Wonderful Screenplay, Cinematography and Editing.While watching the film, one feels so much helpless that how can we help these powerless victims who get trampled by corruption every day. How many Chandrus do we have who will dedicate their lives to the society? Even today we see cops stopping 2W to check documents and extract money. They don't want to touch 4W as they supposedly would have better contacts. Isn't this the same mentality of picking on less powerful guys?Verdict: A wonderful film that will bring tears to your eyes. Torture given to these tribals is worse than what britishers did to our freedom fighters. A film which was truly worthy of representing India in Oscars but alas couldn't get shortlisted.

It's always nice to see a star like Suriya move away from a typical masala flick for Diwali and come up with a hard-hitting courtroom drama based on actual events. In the film, he is more of a tool that helps enact justice for the oppressed victims. There's no showy entry, songs that praise him to the skies, or stock heroines who exist only to admire him. Instead, the film focuses more on the tribal characters played by Manikandan and Lijomol (both excellent) and the series of unfortunate events that they go through.Police brutality has been a sensitive topic, touched upon by very few films and filmmakers, even when we keep hearing several such cases in the news. Films like Visaranai and Karnan paved the way for TJ Gnanavel's Jai Bhim to tell a harrowing social issue without the need to be preachy. Jai Bhim's first hour is a somewhat disturbing watch, with the cries of the oppressed both tugging at your heartstrings and coming across as slightly amplified. There's no subtlety at play. The punches are wholly felt, the screams are heard loud and clear. If you still don't, Sean Roldan's woeful score will drive the point home.

reviews.review_title: Real life story of Justice Chandru about socially downtrodden tribal people in south India.
reviews.content: .The story revolves around the crusade of a conscientious activist lawyer Chandru played to the T by Surya Sivakumar) who fights for the downtrodden masses. Surya has taken the mantle of the firebrand real life advocate and subsequently well known real life hero - Justice Chandru and breathed life in the character. When he is not mouthing dialogues, he conveys a vicissitude of emotion through his handsome visage and those fluid and sharp eyes at every turn but never going over board. In this movie he takes up the fight of a defenseless Irula tribal woman (Senganni)and her quest for justice - her missing husband is(Rajakannu) whose whereabouts are not known after he is dragged into the police lockup for investigating a theft wherein he is the suspect. Surya takes up what looks like a Kargil mountain climbing kind of a case which appears to be an open-shut case in favor of the Tamil Nadu police department. In the process he delves, prods and probes deep into the deep rot into the justice department and the myriad laws and bylaws which subjugates many a valorous but now downtrodden tribe of Irulaa. In this case, it is the ancient Irula tribe who were warriors and plant medicine experts from a bygone era. Now successive governments and local politicians and police machinery use them as broiler chicken criminals to feed their greedy masters to plug loopholes and to gain footholds into higher echelons of power and greed for wealth. Chandru's first court appearance in the movie is about a man from a minority community who has been wrongly incarcerated by the cops, who are under pressure to close pending cases. With a single petition in the Madras High Court, Chandru manages to get bail not just for his client but about 7,000 people, who were possibly arrested on false charges across Tamil Nadu. That moment, you understand the power of courts and how it could be harnessed to hold unscrupulous men in power accountable. Chandru has a worthy adversary in the form of the chief government Advocate General played to perfection by Rao Ramesh (Ram Mohan), an effective and conscientious police officer IG Perumalswamy (Prakash Raj), a persistent social worker fighting for the Irula tribe - Mythra (Rajisha Vijayan, malayalam actress) and Sengenni( Lijomol Jose). One thing striking in the movie is all the protagonists are nonviolent and rebellious who don't bow their head to any form of tyranny. The men who are taken to violence are the villains in this movie. The barbaric methods of the cops were no match to the non-violent resistance and resilience of Rajakannu, Senganni and, of course, Chandru. This is a gripping court room drama filled with a deep social message, powerful dialogues and all round performance by all cast and crew. Now available on Amazon Prime. Rating 3.5/5 Deepavali special with a social message. Must watch.

Jai Bhim movie show cases how an advocate and human rights activist fought for justice for Tribals and Lower caste people who are arrested under false charges for a variety of petty crimes and are subjected to brutality by police and prejudiced judicial system. The story is set in 1993. But as I was watching this story, the tragic lockup deaths of Jayraj and Bennicks in 2020 came to my mind. Police brutality is a real thing. But the plight of tribals and dalits who can't afford high priced advocates to prove their innocence is swept under the rugs.Thanks to Director Gnanavel for coming up with this heart touching movie. Brilliant performances by all actors. Everyone brought the story to life on screen. Good job.

reviews.review_title: Movie of the Millennium. So raw on social issues and abuses undergone by Common and ordinary fellow beings. Must watch!Anything below 10, pretty sure nothing can merry them!
reviews.content: Absolutely spine-chilling story and outstanding cast, emotions, screenplay, direction, bgm. Its a must watch and an epitome of how movies should be made these days, rather than superhero stunts and romantic fantasies, guiding younger generation to ignorance. It would really be true that the actors have lived the characters in the movie and Sengani cast has been played outstandingly by Lijo Mol Jose, Rajkannu by Manikandan. best ever movie made in india.Based on real incident.Must watch.Very first frame. Over a dozen people are released from prison. Outside the jail, an officer asks them the caste they belong to. He sends the upper-caste people (Goundar and Vanniyar) back home. But, those from the Kuravar and Irular tribes are made to stand aside. A group of policemen eye them only to put false cases on them. The reason? They belong to a lower caste, have no money and are treated like orphans.It hits you hard. The first sequence preps you for what's going to come ahead.

reviews.review_title: GREAT ATTEMPT,BUT WITH SLOPPY WRITING AND FLAWS !
reviews.content: Yes It's a real great thing to focus and speak out about the on the ongoing Casteism through a movie, but it's not fair to look at this movie only from an emotional aspect and rate it 5 stars.So I'd like to write a disclaimer more than a review for the audience who are in search for good movies by the ratings given for a movie!*This movie is given a rating of 9.8/10 and It's not worth it !*This movie isn't some kind of a masterpiece with exceptional film making which also doesn't mean this was a bad movie.Poor execution to an average script is the major drawback of the movie which makes it far from perfection.It was over all an average experience for me with sloppy writing and flaws as mentioned!The performance by the actors were so honest and true to the script and yes worth a watch only for the performance and the social message!

It might appeal to those who like documentary-like serious movies.It doesn't dare turn its back on hitting where it hurts the most.

reviews.review_title: Wasted a story about a legend
reviews.content: I don't understand the high ratings. The topic was very good but the execution not and the case they chose to tell the story was very weak you can't make a 2.5 hour movie on this.I hv seen this kind of story in crime petrol and Premchand Stories with much better story telling.They put so much filmy masala and with no depth to the case and unnecessary songs and lame court scenes. I mean there was no real intense debate or speech scene b/w lawyers in the movie which makes you think.You can skip first 1 hour easily. So much over dramatic scenes. So many tollywood like emotional scenes of poor people which you can see in their almost every other movie.And they also distracted from main topic in the middle (caste discrimination).The only thing to watch to watch this movie is that it is based on a true story and the role of the wife otherwise they wasted a good story about a legend.It's the time people should stop giving high ratings to a movie just because it is a south indian movie.Like KGF or Master or na jane kaun kaun si.

The actors who acted in the film are very perfectly. The issue handled in the movie is so real and conveyed in the correct way. Hats off to the cast and Crew. This movie exposed the problem of the minority people and how few police men treated them badly. How the government is ignored these people so far? No voting id and basic needs are not given the people. Everyone should watch this movie and feel the pain. Heart touching movie.

For more than 3000 years now this has been going on and no one has risen up against this modern Indian slavery. America got divided to fight slavery. But Indians who are not impacted by this menace think that those who are suffering are joking. I belong to a higher caste but since childhood I have seen this.

reviews.review_title: One of the exceptional, outstanding movies of Hot Chocolate, Hot Shot, Actor Suriya (Younger Killer Looks). Court drama that is so thoroughly astonishing & engaging right from
reviews.content: One of the exceptional, outstanding movies of Hot Chocolate, Hot Shot, Actor Suriya (Younger Killer Looks). Court drama that is so thoroughly astonishing & engaging right from the start of the movie. Distinctively unique, even from the very first 5-10 minutes. Definitely from the lines of "Visaranai", I am getting used to the recent cinematic legal works such as Nerkonda Paarvai, Ponmagal Vandhal etc, these kind of thought-provoking scripts is fast catching up as a trending inspiration for all film makers.In his Brave & Bold attempt, Director TJ Gnanavel 's Jai Bhim (2 hours, 45 minutes long) flawlessly speaks about custodial violence, police cover-up, systemic corruption at a huge level, that is so hard to logically digest or reason out the whole truth and finally there would be no end to the entire picture. The blame game is never ending.

Jai Bhim is a film of over two and half hours in duration but it doesn't feel so because of fresh and engaging screenplay. The film is more of crime suspense thriller than just courtroom drama. The visuals are stunning. The songs and background music are too good that they elevate a situation to a great extent though they act as speed breakers occasionally. There is nothing bad to say about the performances and in fact they deserve prestigious awards too. I did not find anything wrong in technical aspects of the film to my knowledge.The brutality involved in the film is too high but that is a reality which cannot be denied. I recommend elderly people having heart related issues not to watch this film as some scenes can affect them mentally. It can bring tears during raw intense scenes of beating innocent tribal people including women, severely. In short, it is a must-watch for all children and adults because the content can impact the behaviour of people by making them understand equality of all castes in this society and also digest the fact that there are still people in our country who are oppressed , weak and vulnerable with no identity.

In Many of the Scenes. And also in back ground red flague appearing and in the struggles leaders of the communist Party are present. The real life hero justice Rtd Chandru said that its Karl Marx who taught him to reach Dr Ambedkar. Its very proud to say that jai Bhim is the best film which i have ever seen in my Life. Its a brave and ideal act o Soorya and jyothi ka taking such a revolutionary decision to make this historic film into reality . Congrds T J JNANAWEL/the writer and Director for this heart breaking real life experience shown as a Mind blowing celluloid wonder💖🔥 CR💝

The film is publicized that the movie is based on real facts. However there are many factual errors in the film. For example, the villain is named in the film as Guru, where the actual person's name is Anthonysamy and victim woman is named as Sengeni in the film, where her real name is Parvathi. Film depicts that the victims belong to Irular community where the actual victims (in real) belong to Kuravar community.

reviews.review_title: Exceptional acting and undistorted reality more than compensate for the minor flaws
reviews.content: The actors simply lived their characters and the movie was brutal and unapologetically real about this system of a down that constantly hunts, denies rights and tortures the tribes of this land! Every dark facet of the system is clearly visible and exposed in this movie, in a very matter of fact way! A tight slap by the policeman to the criminal that blabbers arrogantly in Hindi when asked questions in Tamil (although he's well versed in Tamil), despite being the cunning creature engaging in everything illegal was absolutely befitting and not too fantastic to be real! To mainain such momentum despite such a serious and subject is indeed commendable! In my opinion, a movie that really connects with me manages to tear me up a couple of times and this movie gave me at least ten instances with such impactful dialogues and I must say that this is the best Tamil movie I've ever watched!I love the attention to details this movie brings in the backdrop of every other scene, painting a picture of what's in everyone's minds, from time to time, without ever overdoing it, for the sake of appearing artsy! Too many good things to say about this movie honestly!Many critics out here are busy finding the tiniest technical errors to justify that this movie isn't a masterpiece, but this movie is much more and it's purpose is to awaken dead humanity and learn what social justice means, if you didn't know! It serves a greater purpose than being just a work of art that suits the sensibilities of a few (I love art myself, but humanity is bigger than that)!All in all, an absolute must watch, no matter your background!

Bhimrao Ramji Ambedkar 14 April 1891 - 6 December 1956) was an Indian jurist, economist, and social reformer who fought economic and social discrimination against the untouchables (now dalits) in India's Hindu society, and who later renounced Hinduism and inspired the Dalit Buddhist movement. Ambedkar served as chairman of the drafting committee of the Constitution of India, and Minister of Law and Justice in the first cabinet of Jawaharlal Nehru from 1947 to 1951. He is also referred to by the honorific Babasaheb.

In a scene in Jai Bhim, a group of tribals man meet a police office who is heading an inquiry commission about the disappearance of three missing tribals who were being interrogated by the police about a theft case. One man tells him that he was once arrested by cops just for greeting them. Another tells him about how he was arrested just because he tried to slink away fearing them. A woman narrates how her husband was forced to 'confess' to a crime which he had not committed after the cops started molesting her. A young boy mentions that the police picked him up just because they could not get his father, and how that one incident made him a perennial suspect at school. These people are clearly damned if they did, and damned if they didn't.This scene is an echo of the scene that opens the film. We see many prisoners being let out of prison. A few cops from the surrounding police stations are waiting. As each prisoner comes out, he is asked for his caste. If they mention a dominant caste's name, they are asked to leave. But those who belong to a scheduled caste or scheduled tribe, they are told to stand in a corner, only for the waiting cops to pick them up as suspects in the many cases that remain unsolved in their station. When some of them complain that there are too few for them to foist cases on, they are told that they could accuses a few of committing more than one crime.With scenes like these, Jai Bhim powerfully captures the abuse and humiliation that is heaped upon the underprivileged by those in power and the kind of defiance it will take to get them justice. Like Visaaranai and the recent Kavalthurai Ungal Nanban, the film is also a fierce criticism of police brutality. The plot revolves around Rajakannu (Manikandan) and Sengani (Lijomol Jose), a couple who live at Konamalai near Viluppuram. They belong to the Irular tribe, and despite their poverty - they still cannot afford a brick house - they are contented and happy. Especially with their daughter Alli going to school and a second child on its way.But their happiness is dashed when cops come in search of Rajakannu over a robbery. The poor man has become the main suspect just because he happened to be the one who had visited the house where the robbery happened that day to catch a snake. Unable to find him, the police pick up the pregnant Sengani and a few other men from the tribe, including Rajakannu's brother Irutappan. Sengani is later let go - not before being beaten and kicked multiple times - but for Rajakannu and a couple of others, there is no respite from the harrowing violence unleashed upon by the men in khakhi. When Sengani hears that the three men have escaped and their whereabouts unknown, she reached out to Chandru (Suriya), a righteous lawyer who fights for the downtrodden. But can they uncover the truth with an entire system standing against them?Jai Bhim is an unexpected sophomore effort from TJ Gnanavel, who had previously directed the uneven drama Kootathil Oruvan. This is a film that is raw, real and brutal, with gritty filmmaking enhancing the solid writing. It effectively portrays the wrongs that are done to the underprivileged without seeming exploitative or overly melodramatic. Despite being one of the oldest communities in the country, these tribes do not even have any proof to show that they are its citizens and cannot even own a piece of the land. When Mythra (Rajisha Vijayan), a teacher who is part of an adult literacy programme, tries to get them a voter id, the local big shot, who belongs to a dominant caste, retorts, "Isn't it enough we have to request the lower castes to vote for us? Should we also go to the homes of these fellows?"Gnanavel gives us some terrific moments of defiance. Lijomol Jose is quietly powerful as Sengani, who gets a couple of rousing scenes when she turns down efforts at a compromise from cops. Manikandan, too, is effective and stands out in the scene when he urges his men to not give in as that will result in their community being branded as criminals. The director also portrays the intimacy between Sengani and Rajakannu in a charming manner.The film is based on a real-life incident involving Justice K Chandru, from his days as a lawyer. Suriya plays this role with the right amount of intensity and earnestness, which helps the character seem grounded even while the film and Sean Roldan's score try to build him up as a can-do-no-wrong superhero. In fact, his introduction scene wouldn't be out of place in a masala movie. But after Soorarai Pottru, this is another notable film for the star as a performer.And his scenes with Prakash Raj, who plays the inquiry commission head, Perumalsamy, give us calm and composed dialogue that act as a counterpoint to the flinching violence and the moving melodrama. The latter lends the role with a great deal of dignity to a character who believes one has to take up a little bit of authoritarianism to protect democracy. So, we have a lawyer who considers the police as the worst and a cop who finds lawyers the worst working together to ensure justice is done. Through these scenes, Gnanavel - as one of the judges in the film mentions - shows how justice can be upheld when law and order work hand in hand.There are only a couple of missteps. After a point, the violence begins to feel like torture porn, even though the film presents these episodes as flashbacks of events that happened over a day or two. And in a narrative sense, Chandru's efforts to unravel the mystery and his battle in court feels somewhat easier because there are no strong antagonists. Both Rao Ramesh as the advocate general and Guru Somasundaram as the public prosecutor never come across as formidable foes for Chandru in court. That said, as Chandru unravels one cover-up after another, the film makes us realise the extent to which unchecked power can go to maintain status quo.But these doesn't lessen the emotional impact of the film, which, along with films like Visaaranai, Kirumi and Kavalthurai Ungal Nanban, is a much-needed antidote to restore the balance in portrayals of the police in an industry overrun by the Singams and the Saamys.

reviews.review_title: Why only Negative character's name changed from true event??
reviews.content: Film Jai Bheem is based on a true incident. In 1993, a tribal man named Rajakannu, falsely framed in a theft case, was brutally tortured and kiIIed by cops lead by Sub Inspector Anthony Samy. Rajakannu's wife approaches advocate Chandru who fights the case and gets justice for Rajakannu.In the film, Chandru is Chandru, Rajakannu is Rajakannu but Anthony Samy becomes Gurumoorthy. Why? You decide."Our intentions weren't to hurt anyone's sentiments", "we took creative liberty", "It's just based on real life incidents, not a biopic" are just excuses. What's stopping from fictionalizing all the names or to present them as real? Why keep almost all names same as real but fictionalize a few, that too the key name, the main convict's name? You decide. Courtesy Skin doctor.

reviews.review_title: Best movie on casteism and police brutality
reviews.content: I have no words to describe how great this movie is. Though this movie is in telugu but police brutality and casteism remains same no matter in which state that brutality took place. We live in so called 21st century but nothing has changed neither the police brutality nor the casteism. The upper caste still enjoys privileges of being part of that caste and lower caste / tribals bears the harassment from upper caste plus the society. The movie is an eye opener on the casteism that still exists in our fake modern society. This country still need honest lawyers who believes in standing up for those who are denied justice and standing against who misuses the power and law. About the slapping scene where police officer slapped the person to speak in tamil I couldn't find anything offensive. Everyone is proud of their mother language and one should remember hindi is not a national language so dont impose it on everyone. Don't ruin the rational behind the movie over just one scene. The movie shows us the horrible state of this society upper caste lower caste and of course the police brutality no doubt why I still hate police so much.

reviews.review_title: This is a True story that happened 26 years before. Please watch the movie and know how old generation treated people who they think as low grade
reviews.content: The screenplay the script has scenes that are required and necessary. The way it was projected to showcase the true story that happened 26 years before is pretty awesome. Everybody's acting is treat to your eyes. Sengeni character in the movie brings tears every time she appears in search of the truth behind her husband missing. Chandru as a lawyer does anything and everything legally to bring justice to Sengeni. His expressions speak. Climax scene emotions and expressions by Chandru character is awesome and makes you feel the same way he feels. Characters represented as higher grade people treat Rasakannu and Sengeni and their people very bad as if they are untouchables and low grade people. Even when they know these people are good, they won't help them or save them from Police. Lawyers who support villains have done the given job and executed it well. We get angry on why such lawyers even exist helping wrong people and encouraging them to do more. Treat every man and woman from any caste equally. Have heart and treat everybody with humanity. If people we start respecting everybody and treating others with humanity and helping needy people by means of education and employment, each and every family will definitely raise their status from Poverty to at least middle class eventually someday. I request everybody who reads my review to help somebody in need by any means you can help.

reviews.review_title: JAI BHIM JAI BHIM JAI BHIM Gem Of indian cinema.
reviews.content: The best movie in the history of indian cinema inspired by none other than The Great Babasaheb Dr. BR. Ambedkar. This movie highlights the relavance and importance Of values of Babasaheb Dr. BR. Ambedkar. Surya as advocate chandru outperformed his previous characters. Lijomol jose is pillar of the movie. She deserves the most highest honorary award of the country. Prakash Raj as usually lived in the character. He is unmatchable. Manikandan is the best. The movie highlights the plight of Tribals, the atrocities committed on them by police and state. These are the type of movies that are needed for our country. Kudos to Tamil industry. Gnanavel deserves huge applause for his direction and sean Roldan gave excellent BGM. Dont miss the titles at the end of the movie that gives the insight of life of Justice chandru Sir. Please watch hindi movie Halla Ho. JAI BHIM JAI BHIM JAI BHIM.

This movie teach us the power of truth. The battle of truth is always positive and rewarding. Tribal woman had no money. She had only courage to speak truth and belief of getting justice. In the same manner, lawyer only seeks truth from the victim. There was circumstance where the lawyer decided to give up the case. But he was again met with a new truth. This truth made him to stand apart and created the difference.More important is that it is the based on real story of tribal people.

It's always nice to see a star like Suriya move away from a typical masala flick for Diwali and come up with a hard-hitting courtroom drama based on actual events. In the film, he is more of a tool that helps enact justice for the oppressed victims. There's no showy entry, songs that praise him to the skies, or stock heroines who exist only to admire him. Instead, the film focuses more on the tribal characters played by Manikandan and Lijomol (both excellent) and the series of unfortunate events that they go through.

reviews.review_title: Dr.Bhim Rao Ambedkar Sir would have been proud
reviews.content: Thank you Surya for such a true meaningful movie. Yes Dr. Bhim Rao Ambedkar would have been proud of you and so are we.If there was one regret I have about the movie is the name of the inspector who had actually tortured and murdered the an innocent person in the police station should have been ANTHONY (the original name) and not Gurumoorthy. You have maintained character and references to the extant possible, then this should also have not been missed out.Please continue to work on such cherished topics which has lots of impact in the general public through this wonderful medium of movies.Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

reviews.review_title: "It was an experience that I want to cherish for as long as possible."
reviews.content: It is difficult for me to find a suitable set of words to describe my feelings and appreciate this quality cinema. JAI BHIM is a quintessential example of pure acting, a marvelous story, and a superb direction. This 151 min drama portrays the plight of tribal people caused by the caste divide in society.In my opinion, the movie was centered around the oxymoron "good and bad". On one hand, this movie shows the impeccable character of Advocate Chandru, IG officer Perumalsamy, and the devotion of a wife (Senggeni) to his husband (Rajakannu). At the same time, there are characters like Prosecution lawyers (PP C. And S. Ram Mohan), and the 3 culprit policemen.It was highlighted that good and bad comes in pair. Just because the majority of a class is bad, it can't be used as a precedence to generalize that the entire class is bad.On the surface, this movie portrays injustice towards tribal people, police brutality, misuse of government policies by officials, corruption, suppressing and oppressing minorities. But at a deeper level, this movie emphasizes the power of unity, the Integrity of courts, the importance of education, the value of human life and emotions, and how an individual can bring change with self-confidence.This biopic shows the longest case in the history of the Chennai high court. It ends on a positive note that justice in this largest democracy may get delayed, but it will not be lost. Justice will be served and everyone is equal in the eyes of law.

Otherwise the acting is great!

reviews.review_title: A movie worth the National Award and an Oscar
reviews.content: A story based on true incidents that happened in the mid 90s surrounding custodial violence and subsequent death - what you read is nothing compared to witnessing the same on screen.It gave me spine chilling memories of the Sathankulam incident in 2020 of the Father-Son duo (P Jayaraj and Bennicks) who died due to injuries and sexual assault caused to them in custody.#suriyasivakumar reprising the role of Justice Chandru helped us navigate thru' the web of behind-the-scenes dirty govt politics, what it means to be underprivileged, what it means to be ignorant of your legal rights and systemic casteism thrown into your face. Its a shame that these issues exist even today! And I sincerely hope more and more such movies are made to amplify discrimination and social inequalities, create awareness and awaken people to the reality of the system.Superb script, direction and stellar acting from the entire cast!I sat with the sole intention of rooting for my heartthrob ❤ but landed up clapping for everyone! Every single person turned out to be a Hero!

Jai bhim showcast caste discrimination of tribal people,and police brutality and injustice in modern India in the nutshell. Police exploit the tribal people to close out case by frame them and torture them to acknowledge the crime that they never commit. The movie presents two big issues to the state and union governments, that are equlity caused by caste practices and Police Brutality. Police reforms to end the torture and fake cases and body cams and CCTV cameras on every police station. Equality or social justice to give the tribal people a chance to live a peaceful life such as land to live, educational opportunities, care for necessities, change to thought process of caste based inequality.That being said, the movie is well directed, the tribal actors and hero did a good job. Jai Bhim is a good title to show the fight against inequality since Dr. Ambakar name lived his life to fight inequality. Music just made the movie more natural. The scrpts are more natural, scenes and stories are well crafted, good job director. Thanks for producers Suriya and Jothika to make such a movie since it shows their commitment to the wellness of the society. Overall one of the best movies ever and every should watch it.

reviews.review_title: An excellent movie revealing systematic atrocities against the marginalized
reviews.content: Firstly this is based off a true story. The victimized community, the lawyer who fought for them, the political leader who advocated for their justice are all there so do not believe the negative reviews that falsely proclaim it was a lie. This incident shown in the film has been proven in a court of law so to deny it would be unlawful in the first place.Now the movie...The marginalized community was depicted very accurately in the film. It is a sad fact that all over India these real, indigenous people, are still not allowed inside the main areas of the village/township, reduced to do menial jobs, mistreated, and even taken as perpetrators of crime without evidence. This is EXACTLY how they have been shown in the film.The filming crew has given extreme attention to detail when it comes to outlining their characters onscreen (this includes their accent, dressing, jobs, and lifestyle in general).Unlike many Indian films, there are no 'masala' scenes or songs showing heroism. The lawyer character fights for the truth and that's what is shown as well.One other thing to look for a movie is how well the central incident is taken by different characters in the film. The director has captured it perfectly and showcases how prejudice is interwoven in the society and while it is harmless to the unaffected, causes immense pain to the other.The long duration of the film does not cause even an iota of disinterest and puts you on the edge of your seat with its gripping reality.Movies like this should be welcome as eye-openers and proof that Indian flicks do not have to be all about dancing in the rain and catapulting villains.You can certainly find reviews that label this movie as fabricated, divisive etc. But remember, according the honorable (retired) judge of Madras High Court who actually handled the case when he was a lawyer, it was watered down a lot to reduce the gore and pain of the real incident.Kudos to Surya and team, and Amazon for taking up such a bold subject much needed for the society today.

reviews.review_title: Why Law has become a weapon to people like Chandru?
reviews.content: By watching the film trailer, I was under the impression that this is another courtroom drama like Nerkonda Paarvai. But after watching the film, this has a noteworthy crime thriller carefully placed in between the courtroom arguments and it is something beyond a murder case investigation.To me, this is a bold film in terms of storytelling not because they dealt with oppression but they'd told the entire story in the opening scene itself. The oppression begins right from the point when the false case begins on the basis of caste along with the pressure and greed behind closing the pending cases. We already know where it all began and we're just given the feeling of sitting on the time bomb.I feel this film is a domino effect of Visaranai. In the lines of Pariyerum Perumal, this film comes with a different dimension on voicing out the victims. Though the initial 28 mins of the film could've been made a little shorter, the impact it builds as the film progresses justifies the first act.The film has a lot of subtexts and one of my favorites is Chandru's introduction. The slow-motion where Suriya jumps over the barricades is the subtle way of telling the audience that, he will cross all the barriers and hurdles in life no matter what. And the reason is to get justice for people and not for any public stunts. No one can stand between him and people who are robbed off of justice. That's what this slow-motion conveys. This simple shot shows that he's not just another lawyer here, because, among hundreds of lawyers who are actively participating in the strike, only Chandru jumps for Sengani. This is a fantastic foreshadowing (on who's going to save Sengani?), at least to me.The film unfolds in a particular period and one can shy away from taking lots of effort. But Gnanavel made sure that, even the 90s Sun TV logo is authentic. The Pallavan transport passing, the "Bombay" film Cut out (we don't say hoarding those days), the Chetak scooters, Yamaha RX 100, passing in the backdrop, Surya's watch, his Rajdoot bike, and most importantly Ilavarusu watching "Pepsi Ungal Choice" in Sun TV when Sengani character pleads for help. Simply a devil's eyes in the details. The art department silently pillared the director's visions. Gnanavel could've easily diverted us into the story but he raised the bar by not giving up on these details.Also, I never expected this level of quality from Sean Roldan - the composer who elevated many scenes without disturbing the story and narration.The whole film is pinned on Sengeni's point of view. The screenplay is written in such a way that the audience would know a little more than Sengani. I think that's the success of the film. The place where the police jeep crushing the toys would've been a cliché, had the narration dropped anywhere in Raja Kannu's portions. That scene was right on point where the character is crushed to its bones and victimized by sheer power abuse.This is one among the very few films, where you simply can't appreciate just one actor who performed the lead or supporting. Apart from lockup and chili powder scenes, Manikandan's innocent smile or Lijo Mol's dull-looking face would make us feel heavy. Prakash Raj's performance when he couldn't take more and walks away by hearing the saddest of stories from the victims would make us a part of the scene effortlessly. The final credits showing real Chandru leave us thinking, a selfless act from one lawyer saved many and he's no less than god!Above all, it is Suriya. Why? He has a wonderful market in Tamil and Telugu. He could've cast a popular actor for Chandru's role, supported this film as a producer, and easily turned his back from facing heated politics, but he didn't. That's where he stands tall. The urge to take this film on a bigger stage and make sure that it spreads a good message is an act of nobility. The positive effects from the government post-release are so warming to see. That's the power of good films.Surya supported this film exactly the way he supports the kid reading the newspaper in the last scene! On any given day, highly recommended.Jai Bhim - Humanity is free but caste and power abuse make it costly!

While I cannot deny the fact that the movie has been treated in a little unrealistic manner the way mainstream movies does to heighten the impact of the story. Some may cringe, some may whistle. I did wish that it was treated in a matter of fact way, but, I am extremely satisfied thinking that it reaches a larger audience with the kind of treatment it has been given and with the start power of Suriya. Now, when I say star power, I would highly appreciate if many of our stars used their power to bring in stories like this that would actually contribute to the awareness and therefore, progress of the society instead of indulging in no-brainer movies all the time. Of course, one can enjoy it, but when you have such a huge influence on people, why not use it for good? Coming to the movie, despite the minor issue, by and large, I extremely loved it. One can't deny that it makes you think and introspect. The title of movie sounded gimmicky to me initially but by the time the end credits started rolling, I found myself guilty for thinking so. The subtle tribute it gives to the father of the Indian constitution is very well deserved. Of course, such success stories are far and wide from one to the other, but it gives us hope that judiciary wasn't given that extra independence for nothing. For the marginalized section of the society, where even the Government treats them like outsiders in many cases, they have got no one but the judiciary to look up to for protection. It's sad that such cases are very rare. India, by large, hasn't been able to achieve the kind of progress despite all the infrastructural, technological and what not progress that we have achieved over the years, simply because the very foundation of our society is still based on malice, discrimination, prejudice. Where one would openly protest against reservation but would hesitate to speak up for the rights of minorities, it is a clear indication of the fact that we still haven't come out from the clutches of the evils that plagued our society centuries ago. I personally believe that, before the government or judiciary or for that matter, even the constitution, it is extremely important for each and every individual to bring progress within their mindset and conscience. That, in itself would be the start to a progressive environment. This is something I seriously want people to discuss and consider it important. There are many movies based on similar subject, but I recommend you all to watch this wonderful movie. It will definitely make you think.

reviews.review_title: Don't even think twice, just watch it!
reviews.content: Movie begins with the story of tribals from a backward village. It depicts the real challenges faced by the tribals to make their ends meet. The main focus of the movie is on false theft case against Rajakunnu(brilliantly played) and his two friends. Later in the first half, it is marked by the heroic entry of Adv Chandru who fights for the justice and truth. He has played his role superbly, even you can feel his rhetoric in the movie. I really enjoyed some of his punch lines "We can see Gandhi and Nehru but we can't find Bhim". Sengeni, who was wife of Rajakunnu has also played her role brilliantly. At the end of the movie, Sengeni tries to give her Mangal Sutra to Adv Chandra as the fees of her case but he refuses to take it by asking her what if someone would have come to you with agony of snake's bite. Would you not save their life if they were not able to pay you the money. I am really sorry at this point as I have missed a point, this tribe was expert at saving people's life from the snake's bite. This scene is heart melting and you can feel it. Now why am I deducting two stars, the reason is torture performed by the police will give you goosebumps. But in my opinion this has been exaggerated to seek more attention from the audience. But overall, we can say this movie is worth watching.

reviews.review_title: One of the great gripping piece of cinema

Every time you'll feel that now is the end the movie takes another turn and a new substory starts from there.I'd recommend this movie to everyone who really enjoys watchin sensible cinema without senseless exaggeration.Happy watching.

reviews.review_title: One of the best films of 2021
reviews.content: I stand in awe and respect for the cast and crew of this magical movie.In a world, where motion pictures worldwide have sunk to a meaningless abyss on the level of Netflix's "Sex/Life" - a production that doesn't deserve a single star - "Jai Bhim" is one of the reasons we continue to watch movies.Indeed, for some of the most oppressed people of the world, Cinema is more than art, it's their only voice. The true magic of Cinema is to bring people to understand each other better via a keyhole in their lives, and Jai Bhim does it perfectly well.Indeed, the court-room drama may seem oversimplified for the case, but then, we couldn't expect them to elaborate more in an over two-and-half-hours motion picture.A perfect true story, with sublime plot and convincing brilliant acting, a recipe for success, this movie has them all!
