reviews.review_title: Example of 'How Fiction can endorse Reality'
reviews.content: Frankly speaking, as an Indian audience we everyone knows the story, what will come next, what will happen to the victims & how the movie will end.The success of the movie is not keeping all as a suspense but showing exactly what we all expected. QOur subconscious knows that will happen, but consciously we are trying to cover the truth by thinking director will show some thing to entertain us.I think, director took a bold decision to make us (audience) to embarrasse by watching our co-citizens life, how our ignorance affecting them, how our perceptions about dress, speech, education etc makes some one guilty?We are not our conscious. We are our subconscious and this movie is about to disturb it.

This film was one of the finest movies I have ever seen. Great choices of props, style, and clothing to match the cultural context. Lighting was great to match the situations as well as camera angling. For example, low key lighting to match the intense or violent sequences. Dialogue was perfect as there weren't really any cliches of any sort and they hit hard as well. The sound direction was phenomenal. Performances were outstanding. This movie had a good theme as well and how they portray that on screen with their technical aspects was great for making the audience to sympathize with the characters. Whether people agree with the message or not, the movie did an amazing job of calling attention to the marginalized communities and promoting change. It also emphasized the importance of finding truth and restoring faith in the justice system when it fails the people. Those are some of the most important things that we have to open our minds for to this day. Now while the movie isn't 100% accurate accordingly to the true events, we have to remember that is a story constructed based off true events. Its message is basically to let us know that these kinds of atrocities are happening and that we should try to prevent it from happening again. We should focus on the message that they portray through onscreen elements and judge the movie accordingly to that. Overall, great work by the crew!
It was an amazing experience and that hold consistent emotion throughout the movie. I really appreciate the entire team of Jai Bhim as they have done good job.

reviews.review_title: Jai Bhim is a film that also talks about the lack of humanity.
reviews.content: The movie is based on a "Habeas Corpus" writ petition. Where an aboriginal named "Rajakannu" was brutally tortured to death inside the police station like our "Rubel Killing Case" of BD and the police said that he had fled the station along with his two companions. And the government, along with the entire police department, has stepped in to cover up the killings. Because, if this petition goes against the government then their dignity will be questioned.This movie can give you some ideas of how our Executive and Judiciary are governed and how the abominable acts are done by the police. Where the lawmakers are lawbreakers, then what would be the consequence? The law is divided on the basis of caste. The law has become a slave to power and money.Jai Bhim is an important film in the history of Tamil cinema. It shows how caste discrimination and injustice kill people. Jai Bhim is a film that also talks about the lack of humanity. Jai Bhim is a must-watch for its hard-hitting content and its ideologies. It's what society needs right now.Rajakannu's wife make a writ petition through a lawyer named "Chandru". Where they get justice. In his 30 years of career as a lawyer, he has reclaimed the rights of thousands of workers. And he did not receive a penny for all the human rights cases he fought. Later he became a judge of the Chennai court and solved ninety-six thousand cases in six years and seven months. He gave many landmark judgments as well.Good and bad people are everywhere. Not all people are good and not all are bad. Those who just have a bad idea about lawyers can watch this movie.BLAST and others vs. Bangladesh and others ['Section 54 Guidelines Case', or 'Rubel Killing Case' or 'Guidelines on Arrest and Remand Case']

reviews.review_title: 1% OF WORK SHOWN DONE BY DR B R AMBEDKAR.
reviews.content:
Incredible acting only a true story have such a mighty impact on humanity.More such movies on DR BABASAHEB AMBEDKAR are needed to educated the society. Only with such moi\vies will the humanity progress in right path.DR B R AMBEDKAR was
1-Framers greatest leader.2-Freedom fighter
3-NO-2 Person who changed humanity for good.(OXFORD)(NO-1 BUDDHA)
4-GAVE INDIA greatest constitution the biggest democracy of the world.5- Jurist, economist, politician and social reformer, who inspired the Dalit Buddhist movement and campaigned against social discrimination towards the untouchables (Dalits). He was British India's Minister of Labour in Viceroy's Executive Council, Chairman of the Constituent Drafting committee, independent India's first Minister of Law and Justice, and considered the chief architect of the Constitution of India.6-Ambedkar was a prolific student, earning doctorates in economics from both Columbia University and the London School of Economics, gaining reputation as a scholar for his research in law, economics and political science. In his early career, he was an economist, professor, and lawyer. His later life was marked by his political activities; he became involved in campaigning and negotiations for India's independence, publishing journals, advocating political rights and social freedom for Dalits, and contributing significantly to the establishment of the state of India. In 1956, he converted to Buddhism, initiating mass conversions of Dalits.7-In 1990, the Bharat Ratna, India's highest civilian award, was posthumously conferred upon Ambedkar. Ambedkar's legacy includes numerous memorials and depictions in popular culture.

After taking me as her elder child, I got my brothers and sisters from my Dharma Maa, this was all almighty ordered. She is a Tribal Caste Women and I am proud to be called as Shudra Brahmin.

First of all, congrats to the team. Thanks for the enlightening yet gripping drama.Second thing, I wanted to talk about the controversy on a particular scene where the actor Prakash Raj, portraying the IG character, slaps a man for speaking Hindi, and asks him to speak Tamil or Telugu.Imo, there's nothing wrong in asking that person to do so. Before getting angry, please let me explain.The man clearly knew Tamil or Telugu, and was trying to mislead the police team by speaking in Hindi, as the IG didn't know Hindi. So I think it was okay for him to ask him to speak in Tamil or Telugu.The thing is, the Hindi dubbing team should've done the scene like the guy was speaking some other language like Tamil or Telugu, and the IG asking him to speak Hindi.And the director should've made sure that it was done like that.The only thing I find disturbing in this scene is the physical abuse. If only he had just asked him first before assaulting.

'Jai Bhim' is a fascinating, highly entertaining watch accompanied by an incredible realistic tale of custodial harassment, police cover-ups, and systemic corruption, despite its runtime.Suriya is a lawyer who is highly determined to find out the truth behind the missing of three Irular (Tribal Communities) men while in police custody.The superstar delivers an excellent performance as he meticulously peels away at the truth, exposing layers and layers of lies, caste hatred, and atrocities.Lijimol Jose, who portrays Rajakannu's wife, is a freak of nature in the film, performing some of the great scenes and offering a performance that everyone will be proud of.

reviews.review_title: A must watch to understand first hand the way real Indian police treat the poor
reviews.content: Firstly, I want to thank the producer and the director for taking up such a controversial topic in this polarized times we are living in, be it in India or the entire world. We in India are getting polarized to an extreme for every topic and community, where fake news goes unchecked, Whatsapp has become a University in itself to spread lies, deceit and hatred.Coming quickly back to the movie, i do not want to have spoilers, this movie is a marvel, although it is very hard to watch, but i request everyone, as many of us to watch this movie and share this to atleast 2 more friends and colleagues to spread the way we in our country have treated lives of people with the least of dignity and decency. Very sad that things still are in this state in our country, there is no police reform that have been so vociferously demanded. The new govt. Has done no change to the existing system and has only shamelessly continued the use of power.I watched the movie with pain in my heart that when it happens in reality what will be the emotion of the people going through it. And i was in tears when i knew that a lawyer/advocate really existed in real life who actually took this complicated case of atrocities of police against the tribal community. I have heard other things about this advocate who became a judge later on his life. As a lawyer he had taken up 96,000 cases (jaw dropping number) fighting for the under privileged. I salute to this man Mr. Chandru ( i don't know the appropriate title but only respect for this man).I would urge everyone who has able to read this much, to watch this movie and spread the word further. Sad but a powerhouse of a movie. It still manages to end with a positive note and spread the message of courage and conscience. There is no doubt that you will like this movie.

reviews.review_title: Jai Bhim is the best in 2021
reviews.content: One of the exceptional, outstanding movies of Hot Chocolate, Hot Shot, Actor Suriya (Younger Killer Looks). Court drama that is so thoroughly astonishing & engaging right from the start of the movie. Distinctively unique, even from the very first 5-10 minutes. Definitely from the lines of "Visaranai", I am getting used to the recent cinematic legal works such as Nerkonda Paarvai, Ponmagal Vandhal etc, these kind of thought-provoking scripts is fast catching up as a trending inspiration for all film makers.In his Brave & Bold attempt, Director TJ Gnanavel 's Jai Bhim (2 hours, 45 minutes long) flawlessly speaks about custodial violence, police cover-up, systemic corruption at a huge level, that is so hard to logically digest or reason out the whole truth and finally there would be no end to the entire picture. The blame game is never ending.I can add to this saying that Jai Bhim is actually truly-brutally honest, clear-cut reality filled with heart-wrenching scenes, that is sure to leave you feeling that there is more bad in this world than good.One can praise Actor Suriya for his super star performance that is so shockingly awesome, only to discover embarrassing sheets of lies, caste hatred and cruelty. Actor suriya has done a wonderful job of acting so well & so concealed, that I just forgot him in the process, being so much involved in the amazing narration of this deeply appealing, story-telling method that the writer TJ Gnanavel has crafted & adopted.Huge round of applause for the extreme level beautiful Cinematography of S. R. Kathir, which gave this movie it s core life & the element of suspense. Music by Sean Roldan is noteworthy in it s own way, made me feel pain and all kinds of emotions throughout the film. Other actors namely Prakash Raj who shines seperately as usual due to his sensible acting portions for a supporting role, while Rajisha Vijayan, Lijomol Jose, Rao Ramesh deserve a standing ovation and especially K. Manikandan who earned the merit of a special mention. One wonders how he actually did all those gruesome scenes.The director unquestionably has to be awarded for the stupendous success of this movie which solely entertains family audiences without depending upon masala factor or "mass"components.I would definitely watch it again as it was based on detailed portrayal of true events & people!Hats off to the entire Cast & Crew, Team of Jai Bhim! Cheers! ~ Aditya Narayan.

reviews.review_title: 360 degree view of India's social fabric
reviews.content: Rarely, movies move you to think beyond yourself loved self.Jai Bhim is one of them. It is one of those movies which unabashedly shows the plight of the tribals and that you need someone of Chandru's spirit to get justice.I would have loved a bit more about the man Chandru - as from where he got his conviction. A tight editing could have helped here.Having worked bit with tribals, I can say that they too naïve (if that is the word) to comprehend the social structure, power equations and majority wish to lead their lives with dignity and non-interference. Sadly the contrary sets in when power mongers twist and twirl to secure petty benefits. That by favoring and taking sides with power mongers one can secure a raise, a promotion.... dispels the notion that merit prevails and that it would not become a casualty in the future too...With fine actors, the movie is brutally honest and OTT serves this content well. Fancy Censor Board clearing a movie without any cuts.Overall, a gripping ~ 2.42 minutes wherein one is transported to become either a tribal or a Chandru or a honest IG to uphold and celebrate what they have done. On the other hand it also transports one to visualize one as a power mongers and how to modify ones conduct for the betterment of the society.Thank you Producers, Directors, Actors, and an array of stakeholders for sharing the story.

Instead, the film focuses more on the tribal characters played by Manikandan and Lijomol (both excellent) and the series of unfortunate events that they go through.

A landmark movie! It was heartbreaking to see how the marginalised are brutally victimised by the mainstream, by inhuman system of caste inequality and the police brutality. Also it was so heartening to see the triumph of truth in the end thanks to a conscientious lawyer, a teacher, a social worker, judges, a police officer, communist comrades and the unwavering fighting spirit of the wife of the victim. Surya was mind-blowing as a lawyer believing in the ideologies of Dr. Ambedkar, Periyar and Marx. Hats off to the writer, director TJ Gnanavel and the producers Jyothika and Surya for making an amazing movie based on a real-life incident of the justice prevailing in support of the oppressed against the police and the state machinery championed by Justice Chandru. Loved the ending where the little girl emulates Surya which says a lot symbolically! More such movies are the need of the hour!

Amazing acting and story. When a tribal man is arrested for a case of alleged theft, his wife turns to a human-rights lawyer to help bring. Very excellent Film After soorori Pottru another masterpiece from surya.The film has an excellent story plot with good character's sketch The film successfully narrates the realistic lives in india.

When an issue for a rich family crop up, the police, politicians, and judicial systems stands up for them and the greatest lawyers in the country are hired to speak against them and ensure that even though guilty are released with ease. But, in the same scenario when a poor or a backward caste family are stuck around courts seeking justice everything just falls apart. Jai Bhim showcases a story about an honest lawyer who stands for such issues and about a tribal family who seeks justice for their innocence for a case that has been upheld against them.There have been many movies in the past showcasing the issues that the backward caste / tribal people go through by the injustice done by the society as if they don't exist in the normal population. They are treated as a different set of people and termed as UNTOUCHABLES.Since 2020 when OTT is on a rise, there have been multiple movies that have opted for OTT as their route and with no second thoughts Jai Bhim stands out in all the ways. Be it a thought-provoking subject, courtroom drama, people's attitude towards backward, troubles that tribal people face, and to prove that they exist in society. This reminds me of Ambedkar's fight to abolish untouchability in India which still exists in greater parts of India. This plot showcases the story based on true events revolving around a 1995 habeas corpus petition that human rights. (Fundamental right in the Constitution that protects against unlawful and indefinite imprisonment)Suriya once again proves that be it any subject, if done with conviction and honesty will reach people's hearts. His simplicity throughout shows his sincerity towards the character. The other characters in the story are apt as per the proceedings. The initial premise of 25 mins is slow as it sets the stage for the main plot and when the protagonist appears on the screen, that's when the real proceedings follow. There are no punch dialogues or any massy numbers which a regular movie-goer would expect. This is a serious subject which every section should watch and applaud for! The emotions of the tribal people are heart-wrenching (Police station episodes are raw and rustic). The logic in the proceedings never go for a toss, each and every dot connection shows the perfection while execution.To sum up, Jai Bhim proves it point of the empathy that the poor or the tribal people are looking for and this one when ends would stay in your heart for a long time! Very Well Written and executed! (Language is no barrier, Amazon Prime has released the movie in all major languages 😉)

Most scenes were gut-punching to watch, while knowing them to have truly happened in the 90s. Please read if u have time:
it may contain plot spoilers.It has been an hour since I watched the film..
I just cant get over the film, the emotions that I am experiencing is overwhelming...I find rats disgusting.. but there is a entire community of people finding, killing and eating rats for survival..I have never set foot inside a police station ever in my life, but there is a entire community of people who are being harassed, tortured and killed to accept a crime that they have not committed.Being a young adult, the impact this film has, is nothing short of life changing..
in my opinion, students above the age of 15 should be made to watch a censored version of this movie so that they can understand the sad and true state of the society they live in and learn what equality really is.I say censored version because, students cannot handle the brutal use of police force and lockup violence in the film, I just cannot help but wonder, if we think that our children cannot handle a 2 hr long film,
imagine the plight of the children of the people getting dragged out of their homes in the middle of the night, getting stomped on their faces, their mothers getting harassed, their livelihoods getting thrown out the window in a fraction of a second.. such is the sad state of the society we live in.I don't think I can type everything that I am thinking right now in this space..I don't wish to be a critic of such a film and applaud the characters, point out the flaws if any, appreciate the technical aspects of the film.. nope.. not going to..just one word.. if u want your children to treat everyone equally and learn about humanity and mankind... watch it along with them...
after the film ends.. tell them this,every person is equal and each and every man/women deserves respect, be it the servant who work in our homes, a driver who opens the car door for you every morning, the house keeping staff that clean your school bathroom, the security anna who stands by the gate, the grandfathers and grandmothers that come to collect garbage daily from our house, the people who clean our septic tanks and drainage.. tell them that in no way they are neither beneath us nor we above them... I bet they will understand and change the society for better.Jai bhim!

reviews.review_title: Path-breaking! Tribute to Dr. Ambedkar "Jai Bhim"
reviews.content: Excellent movie a master piece direction depicting reality "as is" away from the stereotype nonsensical movies that drifts the nation from meaning generation commitment towards nation building in it true democratic principles. Jai Bhim provides answers to the questions that have not raised for centuries in this nation full of inequality disguise under religious caste dogma. This 164 minutes movie lay bares the sanctimonious democracy that we proudly flaunt as world largest. This century old discrimination is worst of its kind while in other countries even in a lesser form had resulted in social revolutions. In the movie we hear the voice of Dr. Ambedkar, the alone crusader of social justice condemning the human discrimination had still hoped that his countrymen will one day realize if not in his life time but maybe later when the history will be reviewed unbiased and his role to established social reform would be studied as pinnacle of social revolution failed by his own countrymen. The movie title "Jai Bhim" which is proudly used to greet each other by lakhs of Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar followers and Buddhists alike justifies the vision of the father of modern India Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar to educate, organize and agitate against any form of discrimination.

reviews.review_title: jai bhim is An eye-opening honest tale
reviews.content: Jai Bhim is honest and is focused about the brutality of the cops, caste discrimination, the pain of Irulas and how a woman stands against the system with the support of an honest advocate. The best part of Jai Bhim is the screenplay and the hard-hitting narration. The courtroom episodes are well packed. Each and every actor is too good with their performances which makes Jai Bhim a must-watch if you are fond of realistic tales. Jai Bhim sounds like an investigative thriller. Suriya's role has no elevations that a lead actor has in a South Indian film. He behaves like the other role in the film. He plays the role of an activist and an advocate who takes up issues that are ignored in the society. The drama looks narrated in detail and the custodial torture is quite brutal. The climax delivers the justice.
Fantastic screenplay, surya sir prove our acting as beat actor, level of acting prove him I'm not only mass actor also perfect actor. Come back and best actor in industry.

reviews.review_title: Jai Bhim is realistic courtroom drama
reviews.content: Jai Bhim gets the best out of its ensemble of actors, who all turn in great performances. Suriya gives a formidable performance that is measured yet intense. Even though Chandru anchors the film, Jai Bhim truly belongs to the tribal couple Sengeni (Lijomol) and Rajakannu (Manikandan). Lijomol takes the cake with a phenomenal performance. She plays Sengeni with such a beautiful combination of dignity, innocence, and spirit that she becomes the soul of Jai Bhim. Lijomol is fantastically supported by Manikandan, who plays Rajakannu. The film also thankfully avoids forcing a romantic relationship between Chandru and Maithra (Rajisha Vijayan ). In the Tamil mainstream, the top reason to have a female character is still to play the love interest to the hero. Her importance to the story becomes less important. It is refreshing to see a star film sidestep this.
Hard hitting story, some events might even be true, excellent performance by everyone. Most of the scenes look realistic, raw but that makes this movie what it is.

reviews.review_title: Story of words for the movie excellence
reviews.content: A BIG kudos to the team. Well written, directed and jaw-dropping scenes throughout the movie. Suriya sir as usual at his utmost best 👏. Director a big congratulations on the success. The actor did a stupendous job especially Lijomol Jose and K. Manikandan. Jai Bhim is one of the finest films ever made in Indian history. A big star like Suriya decides to bolster the cause of the marginalised and the downtrodden and it's such a respectable action from his side.

N a scene in Jai Bhim, a group of tribals man meet a police office who is heading an inquiry commission about the disappearance of three missing tribals who were being interrogated by the police about a theft case. One man tells him that he was once arrested by cops just for greeting them. Another tells him about how he was arrested just because he tried to slink away fearing them. A woman narrates how her husband was forced to 'confess' to a crime which he had not committed after the cops started molesting her. A young boy mentions that the police picked him up just because they could not get his father, and how that one incident made him a perennial suspect at school. These people are clearly damned if they did, and damned if they didn't.This scene is an echo of the scene that opens the film. We see many prisoners being let out of prison. A few cops from the surrounding police stations are waiting. As each prisoner comes out, he is asked for his caste. If they mention a dominant caste's name, they are asked to leave. But those who belong to a scheduled caste or scheduled tribe, they are told to stand in a corner, only for the waiting cops to pick them up as suspects in the many cases that remain unsolved in their station. When some of them complain that there are too few for them to foist cases on, they are told that they could accuses a few of committing more than one crime.

Making a movie out of a real story is never easy.If the story is one of gross injustice and crimes against humanity it is almost an impossible task to bring it live onto the screens.'Jai Bhim' defies this supposition with an exceptional display of acting, screenplay and situational story telling.The director makes us step into the shoes of each of the main characters of this unbearable story of brutality towards the underdogs of a society. The movie has gone a long way into trying to wake up the human conscience to the tragic, ugly & inevitable consequences of casteism in a society.People like Justice Chandru are the real uncelebrated heroes. They give us hope, optimism and faith in the good human spirit.

#JaiBhimOne of the exceptional, outstanding movies of Hot Chocolate, Hot Shot, Actor Suriya (Younger Killer Looks). Court drama that is so thoroughly astonishing & engaging right from the start of the movie. Distinctively unique, even from the very first 5-10 minutes. Definitely from the lines of "Visaranai", I am getting used to the recent cinematic legal works such as Nerkonda Paarvai, Ponmagal Vandhal etc, these kind of thought-provoking scripts is fast catching up as a trending inspiration for all film makers.In his Brave & Bold attempt, Director TJ Gnanavel 's Jai Bhim (2 hours, 45 minutes long) flawlessly speaks about custodial violence, police cover-up, systemic corruption at a huge level, that is so hard to logically digest or reason out the whole truth and finally there would be no end to the entire picture. The blame game is never ending.I can add to this saying that Jai Bhim is actually truly-brutally honest, clear-cut reality filled with heart-wrenching scenes, that is sure to leave you feeling that there is more bad in this world than good.One can praise Actor Suriya for his super star performance that is so shockingly awesome, only to discover embarrassing sheets of lies, caste hatred and cruelty. Actor suriya has done a wonderful job of acting so well & so concealed, that I just forgot him in the process, being so much involved in the amazing narration of this deeply appealing, story-telling method that the writer TJ Gnanavel has crafted & adopted.Huge round of applause for the extreme level beautiful Cinematography of S. R. Kathir, which gave this movie it s core life & the element of suspense. Music by Sean Roldan is noteworthy in it s own way, made me feel pain and all kinds of emotions throughout the film. Other actors namely Prakash Raj who shines seperately as usual due to his sensible acting portions for a supporting role, while Rajisha Vijayan, Lijomol Jose, Rao Ramesh deserve a standing ovation and especially K. Manikandan who earned the merit of a special mention. One wonders how he actually did all those gruesome scenes.The director unquestionably has to be awarded for the stupendous success of this movie which solely entertains family audiences without depending upon masala factor or "mass"components.I would definitely watch it again as it was based on detailed portrayal of true events & people!Hats off to the entire Cast & Crew, Team of Jai Bhim! Cheers!

Awesome message...... soulful performances...Kudos to the director.Based on a real life incident of 1995 happened in tamil Naidu.The story shows the mirror to indian society bias towards caste system.The movie emphasis the relevance of law and judiciary ..... equality for all.....fair trail ...as fundamental rights provisioned by Dr B R Ambedkar.... to all citizens while formulating the Indian constitution.Hence Jai Bhim.....is the apt title to this movie.

In this movie it's clearly shown that how lower/tribal caste people suffer with horrible things like fake allegations on forgery, theft and other things that they are not even aware of and how the police beats hell out of the victim without any solid proof as per the constitution no policemen can put hands on victims until a solid proof for any allegations that is placed on them is present and I salute to the Lawyer Chandru sir ...how he worked phenomenally on the case without charging any fees and risking his risk for the lower/tribal caste people as per the credits he followed the path of Late B. R. Ambedkar sir. I think this movie should be casted worldwide and It should deserve an OSCAR award .

Bhimrao Ramji Ambedkar 14 April 1891 - 6 December 1956), venerated as Babasaheb was an Indian jurist, economist, politician and social reformer, who inspired the Dalit Buddhist movement and campaigned against social discrimination towards the untouchables (Dalits). He was British India's Minister of Labour in Viceroy's Executive Council, Chairman of the Constituent Drafting committee, independent India's first Minister of Law and Justice, and considered the chief architect of the Constitution of India.

Must watch and understand down ward peoples suffering . All acted well . Screen play is very good ,and it's based on real story .Technical values :
Director Gynanavel, he has done an amazing job with the film. He takes the real-life story of lawyer Chandru and showcases one of his best cases on screen. The way he adapts the screenplay with gripping narration is the highlight. The film shows how the lower castes are suppressed and keep you guessing. The pain that the tribal couple goes through is showcased in a moving manner.Music and BGM by Sean Roldan are just amazing.Kathir with his cinematography portrayed the court scenes in a beautiful and gripping manner. He captured the scenic locations of Munnar in a captivating way.Editing is fine. Production values are good.Highlights :
Suriya fantastic performance
Lijomal jose and manikandan terrific performances
Story & screenplay
Realistic narration
Emotional scenesDrawbacks :
Lengthy runtimeOverall : A Honest and realistic attempt.

Great movie by sough indian industrySuriya plays a crusading lawyer, hell bent on revealing the truth behind three Irular (Scheduled Tribe) men who go missing while being in police custody.The superstar turns in an impeccable performance as he fastidiously chips away at the truth, only to discover layer upon layer of lies, caste hatred and cruelty.Despite having a big name star at his disposal, director T. J. Gnanavel deserves praise for letting the story take the driver's seat, never reducing to unnecessary 'massy' sequences or masala elements to drive the narrative forward.Lijimol Jose as the wife of Rajakannu (played by Manikandan) is an absolute force of nature in her role, delivering some of the best sequences in the film, turning in a performance a veteran would be proud of.Prakash Raj as usual excels in a supporting role while and Rajisha Vijayan had precious little screen time to make any sizeable impact.The music from Seal Roldan played very significant role, helping the audience to feel the pain of the beleaguered protagonists in the beginning and that of vindication and righteousness towards the climax.Jai Bhim does not rise up to the emotional highs of previous classic dramas based.

#JaiBhimWatched a lot of reviews and watched the movie yesterday. In the film, the police tortured the tribal people by trapping them in false cases. Later his case actor Chandra (Surya) fights and wins with logical arguments. This film is based on a true story. Best movie ever seen in tamilPolice brutality has been a sensitive topic, touched upon by very few films and filmmakers, even when we keep hearing several such cases in the news. Films like Visaranai and Karnan paved the way for TJ Gnanavel's Jai Bhim to tell a harrowing social issue without the need to be preachy. Jai Bhim's first hour is a somewhat disturbing watch, with the cries of the oppressed both tugging at your heartstrings and coming across as slightly amplified. There's no subtlety at play. The punches are wholly felt, the screams are heard loud and clear. If you still don't, Sean Roldan's woeful score will drive the point home.

reviews.review_title: A true event dealt with so much detail.
reviews.content: I am grateful to the production Team for bringing up this movie to the public and the eyes of international viewers. It is saddening to have discovered such a treatment to a living soul...damn this sort of torture has started a religion thru Jesus and has won the hearts of people all over the world. Yet, it has happened in modern times...simply disgusting.I am also grateful that the world got to identify a unsung hero Mr Chandru (Lawyer) and a martyr like Rajakannu. It is in fact a classic of the year 2021.The actor Surya (as Lawyer Chandru) has done justice to the role and he is just that good. The actor M. Manikandan (as Rajakannu) has a trove of talent that the Director TJ Gnanavel had used these tools amicably with his class in picturization.I am very grateful to TJ Gnanavel to have decided to do this movie for the world to see. It is available in Prime Video and thru other means that you may get your hands on.I heard that there were some 'useless forces' trying to make this movie a failed attempt due to the same reason that this event came about. I really hope they get a life or just crawl under some rock and die...A time well spent watching this classic and please never every watch this if you are already in despair yourself....Beautiful Job, Surya, Gnanavel, K. Manikandan and crew.

reviews.review_title: Society is still not accepting SC, ST after 74 years freedom
reviews.content: Well I most like in the movie is that there is a law for the lower communities to whom upper cast people are thinking insects. However many people do not know about this law and government, police and many advocates are buying & selling laws when case comes for the tribal. There is a few of advocate who really work honestly and of course few police officers who investigate the case very seriously. Most of the times I have seen that uppercast people misbehave with the SC, ST people. I would like to tell those people that we are MULNIVASI and we are not going to tolerate you guys after the 74 years of freedom. We are a son of Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar and we know how to fight against you with the LAW.

Movie starts with focusing on the issues faced by a minority group in a rural part of Tamil Nadu (state in South India). But i would like to add all tribes matter.

Excellent movie it's very good created by south Indian actor surya Actting is also very nice top rated in indian flim industryAlmost a third of undertrial prisoners in India belong to the scheduled castes and the scheduled tribes, while their share in the total population of the country is less than 25 per cent.Citing these data in a report (external link), the National Dalit Movement for Justice and the National Centre for Dalit Human Rights pointed towards a 'pattern of targeting Dalit and Adivasis and call for investigation of factors leading to the continued victimisation of the community by the police and further victimisation as undertrials'.If you are intrigued by these statistics and want to go beyond them to know what it means to live this institutional harassment and torture without having committed any crime, then watch T J Gnanavel's Jai Bhim on Amazon Prime, starring Suriya in the lead performance.

reviews.review_title: An important movie of the millenium.
reviews.content: The politics here is not watered down; it is direct and takes an incisive look. It doesn't punch down, but up. This is a film that strips down the individual components of caste, law enforcement and justice system and questions each of them on the witness stand. There is simmering anger in Suriya's eyes that is even throughout. But the anger doesn't reduce Suriya to a rabble rouser; it shows dignity too.

reviews.review_title: Jai Bhim - Law is definitely a powerful weapon and a last resort to prove injustice.
reviews.content:
Jai Bhim is such a wonderful movie since it touches on many social things like untouchability, injustice , suffering of humans in the name of power and so many other things.Any real incident when filmed the actor has to carry the role consiously since people see the real people in the face of the actor. Suriya has done complete justice to the role and Carries it throughout the film
Secondly it's not only Suriya but the other actors have done equally well including the actor Prakash Raj, actress Lijomol Jose and every single people who played various roles this sums up the acting in the filmComing to cinematography it was realistic and the shots, angles were convincing. Lighting is excellent what lighting is needed to showcase the story they have been used no personal touches or styles were followedMusic is good, songs and bgm are too good.Finally the real hero Story Screenplay and Direction is class apart because filming is done as what is needed for audience to view the real fight of the people who were distanced by the society and are very far from leading a life that is equal to all. My sincere appreciation to the director as I just could see sengani and the injustice that has happened to her family not just a film there are no other words.In a whole technically as well as story wise the film is one of a kind which will definitely create a impact to your inner soul.Humanity explained, Service to Humanity is service to god.

It's always nice to see a star like Suriya move away from a typical masala flick for Diwali and come up with a hard-hitting courtroom drama based on actual events. In the film, he is more of a tool that helps enact justice for the oppressed victims. There's no showy entry, songs that praise him to the skies, or stock heroines who exist only to admire him. Instead, the film focuses more on the tribal characters played by Manikandan and Lijomol (both excellent) and the series of unfortunate events that they go through.Police brutality has been a sensitive topic, touched upon by very few films and filmmakers, even when we keep hearing several such cases in the news. Films like Visaranai and Karnan paved the way for TJ Gnanavel's Jai Bhim to tell a harrowing social issue without the need to be preachy. Jai Bhim's first hour is a somewhat disturbing watch, with the cries of the oppressed both tugging at your heartstrings and coming across as slightly amplified. There's no subtlety at play. The punches are wholly felt, the screams are heard loud and clear. If you still don't, Sean Roldan's woeful score will drive the point home.But the film gets infinitely better in its final hour. While the finale isn't exactly unpredictable, the journey of getting there is riveting. Both Suriya and Prakash Raj deliver the goods gracefully - not for once, getting in our faces with loud monologues. At a length of 2h 45m, Jai Bhim works due to its performances and topical relevance. Glad that a mainstream audience gets to see it on OTT.77 out of 146 found this helpful.

This film focuses the spotlight on caste-based oppression. Can anybody deny it exists? Inspired by the 1993 Cuddalore incident, when a prisoner disappeared from police custody, leading his wife Parvathy Ammal, an Irula woman, to seek the help of advocate Chandru (played by Suriya). Jai Bhim forces us to confront the shameful reality of the terrible injustices meted out to tribal communities across India.Indeed a brilliant masterpiece by Suriya.

At one point in this nearly three-hour-long film, there is a goosebumps-raising moment that has a tribal woman - also the protagonist - turning her back on power, refusing to bow down to the system of dominance that has exploited the fruits of their labour, quite literally. Looking at it purely from the point of view of Tamil cinema's masala conventions, it is essentially a "mass" scene written for a Dalit character to give her a chance to look at her oppressors in the eye and perhaps tell them: "You cannot break me."

Technical values :
Director Gynanavel, he has done an amazing job with the film. He takes the real-life story of lawyer Chandru and showcases one of his best cases on screen. The way he adapts the screenplay with gripping narration is the highlight. The film shows how the lower castes are suppressed and keep you guessing. The pain that the tribal couple goes through is showcased in a moving manner.Music and BGM by Sean Roldan are just amazing.Kathir with his cinematography portrayed the court scenes in a beautiful and gripping manner. He captured the scenic locations of Munnar in a captivating way.Editing is fine. Production values are good.

reviews.review_title: Raising the bar for Tamil cinema
reviews.content: Imagine that you're a pregnant, illiterate tribal woman. What could you possibly do if your husband went missing after being taken into police custody? Little do you realize that this going be a battle against prejudice, corruption, political influence, local village leaders who wouldn't lift a finger to help you and adamant government officials.There are no unnecessary fight scenes for the hero, which is a trademark of Indian movies. The casting has been spot on, with most members blending with the character naturally.Though the movie duration is over 2 hrs 40 mins, it's highly ensuing after the initial 30 mins past the intro and keeps your eyes glued to the screen. It has all the drama, mystery, twists and turns you'd expect in a fictional story and probably much more, for truth is some times stranger than fiction.To enjoy this movie, watch without any prejudice.

The story is based on true incidents which shows the cruelty of the state. The rights of Adivasis (Tribes) and Dalits has been denied since centuries irrespective of political parties. We just have to sadly admit it!

'Jai Bhim' is perhaps one of the boldest films to have come out of Tamil cinema. It doesn't dare turn its back on hitting where it hurts the most, and its politics is not weighed down by the presence of a star like SuriyaAt one point in this nearly three-hour-long film, there is a goosebumps-raising moment that has a tribal woman - also the protagonist - turning her back on power, refusing to bow down to the system of dominance that has exploited the fruits of their labour, quite literally. Looking at it purely from the point of view of Tamil cinema's masala conventions, it is essentially a "mass" scene written for a Dalit character to give her a chance to look at her oppressors in the eye and perhaps tell them: "You cannot break me."

Jai Bhim review : A Heart touching emotional drama
My rating : 5/5
Performances :
Suriya is terrific as an advocate. He stuns all with his body language, mannerisms, and dialogues. He came with subtle and powerful expressions and his new look attracts all. The actor should be appreciated for picking up such scripts.Lijomal Jose who plays the tribal lady is astonishing in her role. The way she portrays a helpless pregnant lady fighting for her husband is terrific. In the same way, Manikandan, who plays Rajanna is also intense. Be it his look or the way he showcases the pain in all the investigation scenes looks realistic.Rajisha Vijayan also came with a good performance.Rao Ramesh as an advocate showed different mannerisms and body language compared to his earlier films.Prakash Raj performed well as a police officer.Rest of the all other actors are justifying their roles.Technical values :
Director Gynanavel, he has done an amazing job with the film. He takes the real-life story of lawyer Chandru and showcases one of his best cases on screen. The way he adapts the screenplay with gripping narration is the highlight. The film shows how the lower castes are suppressed and keep you guessing. The pain that the tribal couple goes through is showcased in a moving manner.Music and BGM by Sean Roldan are just amazing.Kathir with his cinematography portrayed the court scenes in a beautiful and gripping manner. He captured the scenic locations of Munnar in a captivating way.Editing is fine. Production values are good.Highlights :
Suriya fantastic performance
Lijomal jose and manikandan terrific performances
Story & screenplay
Realistic narration
Emotional scenesDrawbacks :
Lengthy runtimeOverall : A Honest and realistic attempt.

Social justice and the downtrodden suppressed people are clearly shown in this movie. How the court works, how the civil laws are constructed, how police powers are getting misused were clearly conveyed. Surya, Manikandan, Lijomol and entire team did great job.

This scene is an echo of the scene that opens the film. We see many prisoners being let out of prison. A few cops from the surrounding police stations are waiting. As each prisoner comes out, he is asked for his caste. If they mention a dominant caste's name, they are asked to leave. But those who belong to a scheduled caste or scheduled tribe, they are told to stand in a corner, only for the waiting cops to pick them up as suspects in the many cases that remain unsolved in their station. When some of them complain that there are too few for them to foist cases on, they are told that they could accuses a few of committing more than one crime.

To some up, it's the voice of the voiceless that has to be heard, but I question few things about the director's intentions
1. CJ Bhaskar's character really doesn't contribute anything to this story, why does he chant Shiva and has a brahmin accent ?2. The much talked about Vanniyar Calendar, d prop and set design, could have done without the calendar too, but seems to be a calculated Easter egg placed
3. When the pawn shop guy speaks in Hindi, d cop slaps and asks him to speak in English. Anti Hindi sentiment is deep rooted in our culture for a reason , we opposed people who forced us to learn and accept a language, again this scene is d reversal of anti hindi sentiments, guess the director thought of this as a clap block scene. All this said, these r oly mild remarks had and I am not startled or offended by these and certainly doesn't call for Violence against the actor producer. Kudos to the team for this stellar movie.

reviews.review_title: Overrated decent commercial movie with little mistakes

The Sengani actor was a perfect match for Rajakannu actor manikandan but her face looked artificial at many points. Manikandan excelled at his performance. He acted like a real tribe. If there were still few losses to make it look real, I would have given it 9. The bgm gave goosebumps but the dialogues failed at some points. The guy who played the AG character has also did a good performance even though he is coming from the telugu industry. The police officer should have been given bold dialogues at the court too. The police officer was shown so weak at the court unlike from the police station. This movie is decent but This isn't a perfect movie .

There's some serious upvoting for this film here on IMDb; if not for a weighted averaging of the film's rating by viewers, this would be the number one movie of all time having just come out this year, and that by a wide margin. I thought the movie was good for it's portrayal of corrupt authorities taken down by a dedicated attorney, it hit on many of the points that social justice advocates clamor for here in this country. Based on a true story, one can only marvel at the dedication of a man like Chandru (Suriya), who utilized every bit of means and cunning to humiliate the brutal police authorities and their corrupt political allies. Many times it's a difficult story to watch, as the beatings and punishment doled out by district police against members of lower castes approach grotesquely inhumane treatment. Chandru's efforts eventually pay off, and it was inspiring to see him honored by the citizens he represented at the finale, reminiscent of that final scene of Gregory Peck in "To Kill A Mockingbird".One note of caution when coming to the IMDb title page - the names of characters listed in the credits don't match the corresponding identification of characters in the film. As an example, actress Lijo Mol Jose portrayed the agonized wife Sengoni in the credits, but in the film, captioning described her as 'Sannamma'. I'm not versed well enough in Indian nomenclature to know if that's a result of translation or some other factor. I would also question the narrative offered at the end of the story that stated the attorney portrayed in the picture was responsible for ninety six thousand cases in six years. To do that, he would have to have been involved with over forty cases per day, every single day for six years, with no days off!

Art of direction with master acting. Jai Bhim transl. Victory to Bhim is a 2021 Indian Tamil-language legal drama film directed by T. J. Gnanavel and produced by Jyothika and Suriya under 2D Entertainment. The film stars Suriya and Lijomol Jose with Manikandan, Rajisha Vijayan, Prakash Raj, Rao Ramesh and others in supporting roles. The film deals with the subject of police bias and state violence against a marginalised community Based on a true incident in 1995, which involves a case fought by Justice K. Chandru it revolves around the lives of Sengeni and Rajakannu, a couple from the Irular tribe Rajakannu was arrested by the police, and was later missing from the police station. Sengeni seeks the help of an advocate Chandru to seek justice for her husband. Chandru files a habeas corpus case and he refers Rajan case to continue further to find the.

"Jai Bhim" is a Crime - Drama movie in which we watch a man being accused and arrested as a thief. His wife with the help of a lawyer try very hard to bring justice and find out what exactly happened.

reviews.review_title: Jai Bhim (2021) is a must-watch film for anyone interested in understanding the complexities of caste-based discrimination in India.
reviews.content: The film's story follows the life of a young Dalit man named Mukesh, who is struggling to make a living and fight against the systemic oppression that he and his community face every day. The film's portrayal of Mukesh's experiences, and the obstacles he must overcome, is both heart-wrenching and inspiring.One of the film's strengths is its portrayal of the Dalit community's cultural and political heritage. The film takes the time to showcase the history of the Jai Bhim movement, and the role that Dalit activists play in fighting for their rights. This aspect of the film helps to contextualize the struggles of the Dalit community, and the importance of the Jai Bhim movement.The film's cinematography is top-notch, with beautiful landscapes and intricate shots that bring the film's world to life. The film's soundtrack is also noteworthy, with moving compositions that elevate the film's emotional impact.

This is not a top 250 movie. Rating is biased and not weighted correctly. Only for a particular audience.Summary:
It's about a pregnant woman from a primitive tribal community, searches desperately for her husband, who is missing from police custody. A High Court advocate rises in support to find her husband and seek justice for them.Plot:
In 1993, Rajakannu and Sengeni are a couple from the oppressed Irula tribe who labor in the fields of oppressive caste men to control rat infestation and catch venomous snakes. Rajakannu is called to a rich man's dwelling to catch a snake that sneaked inside a room. The next day, a case of burglary is reported when the wife of the man reports missing jewellery pieces from her closet and raises doubt on Rajakannu. The police invade Rajakannu's home to find evidence. Rajakannu had left the town earlier for work. During the invasion, the police brutally beat and unlawfully detain the pregnant Sengeni. The police arrest other relatives: Rajakannu's brother Iruttupan, his sister Pachaiammal and his brother-in-law Mosakutty, and torture them to confess Rajakannu's whereabouts. The police find Rajakannu and imprison him. They torture him to confess the crime but release Sengeni. Later, she is informed that all three men in detention are absconding and police threaten her furthermore to tell them about their whereabouts.

Very Engaging. Works towards social upliftment. Everyone has done justice to his/her character. Please watch at least once. The way Surya performed is unmatched. Really South Indian Films doing wonders.

reviews.review_title: Intense, raw, rustic, suspense - surya nailed it
reviews.content: I want to whole heartedly support and thank Surya for selecting this subject and no nonsense melody track (where few movies unnecessarily kept). I wish lot of other big or star actors should start to select these kind of raw subjects which is hard hitting on people's mind to make them feel / involve / think.

In the original case, the wife of the victim, who fought for justice, was Parvati. Her name has been changed. The name of one of the co-accused (victim) was Govindaraju. That too has been changed in the movie.The overtly Hindu names on the side of the victim have been changed. The overtly Hindu names on the side of the perpetrators have been retained. And the Christian name of the main accused has been changed to a Hindu-sounding name. (Details of the original case can be seen here).The role of the judge character is minimal, though in the case the movie is based on, the judge played an important role. The habeas corpus writ petition in the real case was dealt with by Justice P S Mishra. The man was a Gandhian and incidentally a Brahmin, and was a man of integrity and humanism. A prominent mentor of Justice Mishra was Jayaprakash Narayan. But then, highlighting these aspects of the judge in any way would be contrary to the narrative the movie was trying to build.Also, in the original case, the community which the victims belonged to was the Kurava. Even this has been changed to the Irula community.Pretty soon we know why.As the end credits start rolling, we see a bunch of Claretian missionaries of the Catholic Church being thanked. These are a branch of missionaries who are into evangelizing the Irula communities. They use the schemes of the central government, like the 'Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana' and make Irulas the beneficiaries; but all of this is executed through the hands of missionaries.The Irula community are people with strong ties to Hindu Dharma. In 2008, this writer reviewed a book on Irulars. Irulars, while being a tribal community, had close relations with non-tribals too. They worship Sapta-Matrika, Rangaswamy and Siva. The rice pounded by them used to be offered to Siva in the famous temple of Alangadu.But with the arrival of the mills and the weakening of traditional relations with the advent of British, they were declared a 'criminal tribe'.In post-independent India those who fought for Irular rights included Kamaraj, Rajaji and Pasumpon Thevar.Yet, a history of 'caste-Hindu' indifference as well as abuse of the tribal communities had to be constructed. And the discrimination practiced by the state machinery was somehow blamed on the 'caste-Hindu' structure.What can be a better medium to further this narrative than a popular movie?Already, a lot of Hindu social activists and organisations are working silently with the tribal communities. But their work is never based on victimhood narratives or on creating enmity between communities. On the other hand, Christian proselytising predicates itself on such narrative-building which puts the 'oppressive caste-Hindus' against the 'liberating missionaries-and-or-Marxists'.Now think why the Kuravas were changed to Irulas. The memory of them being declared as an 'ST' by Modi government in 2016 may still be fresh. The recommendation to classify Narikuravas as a 'Scheduled Tribe' was initiated by Dr MGR in the '80s. But as late as 2013, the UPA, which was forced to bring a bill because of the agitations of the community, could not pass it.It was the Modi government which ultimately fulfilled the long-standing demand of three important but highly marginalised tribal communities.Clearly, every aspect that could create even a sense of social harmony has been avoided in the movie.For a product of the Chennai film industry, the movie is extraordinarily well crafted - though compared to the similar 'lawyer getting justice for the marginalised' genre in Hollywood, its Chennai counterpart is still in infancy.Ultimately though, Jai Bhim leads the viewer away from reality, from the real causes and from the real heroes. Unfortunately, when good people do not propagate the truth, such distortions are bound to spread and believed to be the truth instead.

reviews.review_title: Touched my heart to the core
reviews.content: JAI BHIM 🙏🙏🙏I finally had the opportunity to watch this wonderful film 💞 with my wife on Amazon prime today. Though we are Telugu speaking couple, we decided to watch it in it's original tongue Tamil with subtitles so that we don't miss it's authenticity 🙂. And I must say we made the right choice, we went through a journey of emotions like Sad 😭, Angry 😡, and Joy 😆 through out the length of this movie.My heart goes out to the victims who had to endure such brutality in our country 😭😭😭. I really wish there are no more such evils in our society🙏. But, it is a shame to admit that there are still such things and people exist in our country 🤦🤦🤦.A huge round of applause to the entire cast 👏👏👏, each and everyone both on and off the screen delivered their role with utmost dedication. They were all fluent and just outstanding.Writing, Cinematography, and Direction are all of top notch 👌. Another round of applause to the crew👏👏👏 for sticking to the story and not inject any commercial elements. Which is very bold and very rare in our Indian film industry. This will remain as one of the finest gems of Kollywood 👍.And finally I just wanted to express my deepest appreciation for the entire film crew for portraying such a heart-wrenching film based on a real story without compromising with any commercial elements.My sincere gratitude to real life hero Mr. CHANDRU for doing the God's work. God bless you sir you are our God.🙏🙏🙏

reviews.review_title: Tamil : Top-Notch Film Speaks Below Community
reviews.content: This was one of the best movies I have watched in recent years.. that too based on true facts.Casting, Story, Acting, Direction every small thing made a masterstroke here.Surya as leading actor lawyer and Lijo Mol Jose as Sengoni made a remarkable and splending performance.Once again, was very sad on checking the true facts which the movie brought in front with remarkable drama. One of the best movies that I've seen in the recent past. Suriya performance is absolutely stunning. Sinathalli aced the role... Amazing actress. I'm sure this movie will win multiple awards. This is no doubt an Oscar qualifier. Screenplay & direction is just amazing.One of the exceptional, outstanding movies of Hot Chocolate, Hot Shot, Actor Suriya (Younger Killer Looks). Court drama that is so thoroughly astonishing & engaging right from the start of the movie. Distinctively unique, even from the very first 5-10 minutes. Definitely from the lines of "Visaranai", I am getting used to the recent cinematic legal works such as Nerkonda Paarvai, Ponmagal Vandhal etc, these kind of thought-provoking scripts is fast catching up as a trending inspiration for all film makers.In his Brave & Bold attempt, Director TJ Gnanavel 's Jai Bhim (2 hours, 45 minutes long) flawlessly speaks about custodial violence, police cover-up, systemic corruption at a huge level, that is so hard to logically digest or reason out the whole truth and finally there would be no end to the entire picture. The blame game is never ending.I can add to this saying that Jai Bhim is actually truly-brutally honest, clear-cut reality filled with heart-wrenching scenes, that is sure to leave you feeling that there is more bad in this world than good.One can praise Actor Suriya for his super star performance that is so shockingly awesome, only to discover embarrassing sheets of lies, caste hatred and cruelty. Actor suriya has done a wonderful job of acting so well & so concealed, that I just forgot him in the process, being so much involved in the amazing narration of this deeply appealing, story-telling method that the writer TJ Gnanavel has crafted & adopted.Huge round of applause for the extreme level beautiful Cinematography of S. R. Kathir, which gave this movie it s core life & the element of suspense. Music by Sean Roldan is noteworthy in it s own way, made me feel pain and all kinds of emotions throughout the film. Other actors namely Prakash Raj who shines seperately as usual due to his sensible acting portions for a supporting role, while Rajisha Vijayan, Lijomol Jose, Rao Ramesh deserve a standing ovation and especially K. Manikandan who earned the merit of a special mention. One wonders how he actually did all those gruesome scenes.

reviews.review_title: A visually gripping, heart-breaking, and a masterful piece uncovering the brutality of a spineless section of police!

Despite the astounding portrayal of the advocacy by one of the top 0.1% of 0.1% lawyers, the law and order could still be seen as if it were slithering away from your instinctive, moral feet. I mean, what a roller coaster ride it was! Concluding my thoughts, this movie is no short of a legal battle played by an erdudite lawyer against the atrocities and deceits of the so-called "BiGgEst DeMocRacy iN tHe WorLd"!

Jai Bhim is Tamil language film about caste discrimination in souther part of India. The title means "victory to bhim" referring to B. R. Ambedkar, widely considered as father of Indian constitution. This is a realistic portrayal of judicial system and third degree treatment of the police towards tribals in India.The movie is based on true events happened in Tamil Nadu in 1995. The movie is shot and directed spectacularly to keep the audience engaged till the last minute. It has various emotions in the right place and the second half of the movie is the most engaging.It is hard hitting movie questioning any type of discrimination. There are some reviews which gives a false impression of the movie.. watch it yourself and decide.

reviews.review_title: One of the Best in Kollywood
reviews.content:
Equality Matter's.. Show Love to People around & Help them With Humanity While Struglling with Caste & Religion "Say's Jai Bhim Movie"Songs & BGM are Excellent.Cinematography & the Sets Percfet.The Moral :-
The Way Movie is Potrayed Melts the Heart. We Need a Change to Behave Equal With Each & Every Personalities Surrouned. No one lesser & greater, We are Equal
Jai Bhim is a Story For us to have a Better Society Further. We need a Nation With Equality.

While watching the movie the very particular thought that it is a real life move was completely disturbing. Tears rolled out understanding few fellow men just like us with families are left to be victimized by the system simply because the bureaucracy "can do it". It is a very powerful movie where the reality slaps you right in the face. How having a voter id or vote bank can protect some citizens from system abuse. Only concern was the viewers should have been informed that the police knew the real culprits and they have a share with the theft. That would have made us understand the severe torture meted out to the victims by the police. Revealing at the end might be good from a cinema point of view but it takes away the vital information from the viewers which they need to know to understand the entire brutality. This movie will bring in some required social changes in the society. The importance of adequate representation for every oppressed community was clearly evident. Tamil film industry will lead the infian movie industry in making movies based out of the social fabric of the society. Which while in remake will be missed out as was the case with asuran. Watch these type of movies in their native language to understand the actual pain and plight. My heartly congratulations in making a wonderful movieti enlighten the masses about oppression. Tamil cinemas kudos to you. Make fantabulous movies like these in the future as well.
The length of the movie is 2.3 hours but you start the movie the time will fly and you don't feel like skipping any part.Superb acting skills , good plot and subplot.
Awesome cast and every actor given their best performance to get such a beautiful outcome....wish our Indian Movies will hit back with great concepts again. Feel good movie after longtime...

Not jus a movie..but truth about social injustice..Surya..other heros needs to learn from him. Then I realised that yes, I haven't seen any movie on tribes and this is something that needs attention.

Just saw jai bhim. Thoroughly astonishing and engaging from the start. No words can do justice to describe how well this movie is made.Very few films will make you go through a range of emotions and this movie does it seamlessly well. You will feel anger, joy, pain, despair while watching this one. Don't remember going through such range of emotions while watching any other movie.Hindi film industry is still stuck making ch#&_ya movies like Sooryavanshi and South Indian film industry is churning out one gem after another. Jai bhim is by far the best movie I have seen.Hope India sends this movie to the Oscars for it to get due international recognition and India winning it's first Oscar best movie.

Words are very less to express my Thanks to Suriya and whole team.Movie started with a poor but happy family, but one thinking made their life destroy. Sangini the character alone is strong character.Those who thinking this movie belongs to a perticulur community then they are missing India's Masterpiece movie. Writer directors specially taken care about the hearth about the movie which is social msg and real story, this movie has not a single dialogue with the word "Jai Bhim" but whole movie given a msg more than this word. In India lower caste people greetings with the word "Jai Bhim" just like western countries say "Hello" as a greeting word. "Jai Bhim" coming from Dr. Bhimrao Ambedkar who is father of Indian constitution coming from lower cast community.This movie based on real story which is happened in 90s. Every scenes in the movie shows that the details study of whole team on each character.Director also not looks intrested in any hate communal dailouge, she sticked with the real story very well.Pregnant lady she is main character because story revolving around her her acting look more real.Sometimes movie gives feel like you are watching actual cctv footage of the real story.Thanks to Suriya because no Bollywood actor or director will dare to toch this topic as they are more interested in money making and undigestable comedy or same singam style movie.Bollywood need to take classes first from Tamil industry then we can expect from them atleast some better content.People Alredy proves that they want pure content without any masala, movie named "Sairat" (Marathi Movie) made a history in Marathi industry because people knows that marathi industry is full of Brahmin people. But Maharashtra liked the subject of "Sairat".Bollywood should know that people don't want glamour anymore they are hungry for an Art, they don't want all time white actress or Gym actors.People more intrest in pure art.Once again I would say "Jai Bhim" is a Masterpiece movie in Indian history.

The plot of the movie is based on true Events Set in 1995, Jai Bhim revolves around the arrest of three Irular (a Scheduled Tribe) men in a theft case. Actually 25 years old story Worked Has a New story. Movie Starts with "Cast discrimination" and they shows openly how the police are stereotypely working for there cases too complete ( fake arreste from particular community ).Court room drama is not a new genre but this movie is differs from other court room drama genre because of detailing work, cast and crew selection ,dialogues and Normal court room drama changed to Suspense crime thriller because of the Screenplay. Best part of the movie is music literally makes us too cry in Emotional scenes.Postive of the movie is relationship between chandru and I.g .perumalsamy. Although nearly three hours long, it manages to keep us gripped. There is not a moment that drags. Surya calm and angry acting Worked well Tribal peoples actors acting are too natural.Unique thing is one man Against the total government for justice that makes Movie too strong.Somebody can felt little bit lag but this movie needs that much length personally I don't feel any lag after the chandru Entry I felt only curious.Overall movie is Worthy and Must watch movie. Trust me it's not a biased movie Everyone should must watch this movie.

The music suits every part of the movie and gives the extra feel and emotion to the scene and making it feel we are there. I loved this movie and cried.. fantastic direction of real story.

We can close our eyes and say nothing happening like this in my surrounding. But my friend it's a 1.3 billion people country. In rural area this thing happen in regular basis. I doubt are we still got freedom?
The screenplay and acting were on point, there was no messing around,they get right to the point and stick to the point till the end. Amazing movie experience.

This is a very powerful movie with a very strong story. The scenes and actors are very realistic. There were no attempts made to glorify any parts which is common in Indian movies. However, the police brutality is shown with too much gory, violent and graphic details, which are very unpleasant to watch. These scenes could have been toned down. I think it was not necessary to show this repeatedly - we get the point after the first time. There is also striking similarity of this film and the Marshall (2017), and I would not be surprised if Jai Bhim (2021) was inspired by Marshall (2017), although both are based true stories.

This movie will keep you engaged throughout. Sometimes will make you cry, sometimes smile,sometimes hate humanity, sometimes love humanity, sometimes make you feel pity, sometimes heart broken. You will get mixed emotions in this movie which is the victory of the screenplay, direction and acting.

It's not just a movie it is more than that,it depicts the country's ugly truth be it cast discrimination, be it oppression of so called lower cast people,be it perfoming untouchability. All these negative things still prevailing in India especially in remote areas of country. This movie's title it self is so powerful to give justice to vulnerable section of the society. Jay bhim is not just a slogan,it's a revolution of thoughts of Trinity i.e.liberty, equality and fraternity. Kudos to south film industry to put forward such a untouched and unheard real facts infront of the nation. Big salute to the person who's name is not even uttered in the movie but whole movie was revolving around his thoughts. Jay Bhim.

Cast:
I've seen Lijo Mol Jose in a previous movie and I was surprised when I saw her name in the cast as Sengoni. She has done a great job in this role, followed by Manikandan(Rajakannu) and finally Surya making us speechless with his performance. The other cast also did a great job.Music:
The songs in the movies may not be catchy or commercial but it helped the audience to feel the emotion which the movie wanted to convey. The BGM were so good and very apt for the film.Direction:
T. J Gnanavel has given quality movies in the past but this one is his masterpiece till date. It will be one of the best movies he has directed. The movie was simple, to the point and kept the audience nailed to the seat.This movie is based on true events and shows what injustice and hardship tribal community has gone through. It is a long film with 2hr and 40 min screen time but not even in one scene it felt slow. It has a nice pace and awesome dialogue and screenplay which will make almost 3 hrs feel so short. If the movie went on for another hour I wouldn't have complained.The film was finished and released even in this pandemic so hats off to the entire team. This is by far the best movie Ive seen this year. I wouldn't be surprised if bags multiple national awards.

Every scene in this movie is Rollercoaster ride of emotions and truth. Must watch movie for atleast once in a lifetime. From Actors to plot all is just remarkable and fantastic. One can easily feel the pain of victims and i think no one in this world can dislike this masterpiece.

Movie makes you feel the raw emotions of characters. The background score is apt to scenes and it showcases the real life problems.The movie is based on a true event , the camera work is excellent , the courtroom set was well designed it's resemble the actual court.

A must watch for all.. The movie addresses the injustices endured by the tribals.. This oppression is still being carried out in modern societies which needs to change.. They deserve the dignity of living.. Surya and Prakash Raj have nailed their roles getting into the skin of the character..

reviews.review_title: Great movie, very thought provoking and depicting everything in reality!!!
reviews.content: Great movie, very thought provoking and depicting everything close to reality vs making it unreal just to get audience!!! You won't be disappointed with this movie, absolutely Oscar worthy movie.
Excellent movie... Real Story of judge chandru tamilnadu ..surya Prakash Raj acting was good. After soorarai potru good movie from surya..must watch movie..Real entertainer.

Bollywood should learn from such high class content movie not just dub each high rated south movie.Screenplay story , Suriya's acting and overall presentation of story was outstanding
Need this kind of movies in Bollywood also so that larger audience can influence. This can be social work also.Hats off to Suriya and other production house.
This movie makes a deep impact on those who are watching taking tamil cinema to next level. Pain of underprivileged demonstrated beautifully. Suriya has done justice to his role, Hats off.
Best movie to watch. This movie is about an true incident and how a true lawyer Mr. Chandru brought justice to the people. Real people also acted in this movie.

Highly recommended movie from my side, it gives tears, how people can oppress other religions.Very unfortunate that still some people in our nation not able to get their fundamental rights. Shame on such a system.Excellent work by the cast. Bravo.

reviews.review_title: There is no compromise in the acting each and every character gave their best. Watching a movie for 160 minutes is pretty hard these days, but not once did I feel like it was
reviews.content: There is no compromise in the acting each and every character gave their best. Watching a movie for 160 minutes is pretty hard these days, but not once did I feel like it was stretching. The time passed so gracefully with a great excitement as to what would happen next.Must watch movie as it tells the importance of how diligent workers like police and law should be united for the betterment of a society.
Very relevant subject to show present situation of country... They are brave enough to show this side of country like a slap, kudos to producer and all the crew members. JAI BHIM 💪🏽🙏🏻

reviews.review_title: This is a learning session for LIFE.
reviews.content: Like every human being has equal rights to leave their life.Police has to be maintain their law an order as per discipline.At the end great acting by "Lijo mol Jose" and great direction!! Claps :)

Great movie. All actors were awesome. Real story, fantastic direction. Every Indian should watch this movie to get idea of reality. Mirror of society is shown. Your heart will melt down, eyes will be bleeding.

Show the case is way of truth. The movie was sshiw the life of tribles ...
The trible is humans thay have a drems and family thay have a righte to live in the socity that the movie show is the another way to say surya as adv. Chandru role is super and Insparing the law student ..

Jai Bhim Movie is Oscar Deserving Movie. In this case, Prakash Raj is seen in a very good character, in the role of tribal, both the characters have given life to the whole movie, Surya sir's role is very good, who is in the character of Chandra who fights for the rights of poor tribals. Hai Jai Bhim movie is very good, you all must see a real best that happened in 1995, even today after the country's independence, such an incident keeps happening, for the first time in India, a movie has been made on the subjects of poor tribals. All the movies of Surya sir are number one and if Prakash Raj sir comes together then it becomes even more hit. The police have been brutalizing the tribals for years.

The genre of movie making the nation is in dire need off! To put forth social evils to an audience that is still ingrained in some of these practices is a humungous challenge and to gain traction amongst them to bring about social change is commendable.
One of the best movies in Indian cinema industry. I felt the pain of the people who are suffered by the power and wealth people. All actors lived in their characters.

reviews.review_title: its great movie hatsoff to all JAI BHIM team.......
reviews.content:
I just want to say that....the movie is very classy and meaningful one....
no drama ,,it shows the backlog of our modern society where the people of lower caste how treated badly by our society just bcz of their caste......the title of the movie JAI BHIM resembles the equality (dr B R AMBEDKAR=the symbol of equality)............
.............everyone must watch #JAIBHIM.

reviews.review_title: Best Movie ever fir for oscar
reviews.content:
This is movie really aspiring us. And this is the reality of old and present india..
Bollywood can learn from it. And i like this movie can best for academy award so i thing this movie go for it. Because this is the reality of india. Tribal area..
